text: Absolutely one of our new favorites! The atmosphere and food is excellent, and Brian the GM is professional and personable! Don't miss this spot!

Great service.  Pleasantly surprised.  Burger was cooked to perfection, the chicken breast might have been the best ever - perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The sweet potato tots were a very nice surprise.  Great experience.

Visually the restaurant is awesome, I liked the open kitchen, hand washing area and condiment station. In my opinion, the food was average; I ordered a cheese burger medium done. The meat was flavorless and the bun was stale. Very disappointing, I expected a delicious burger from a place the specializes in burgers!! 
The price was a little high too for such a basic burger. 
I will not be returning to this restaurant.

They don't sell lemonade or anything fresh to drink (i didn't like that)  the food was not worth what I paid. Overpriced and Undercooked. Your better off eating at a In and Out or Applebee's better prices and better food than this place.

First time eating here, food was ok. I had an old school burger, fries and a coke. The fries are really good, however, my burger was NOT good. Perhaps it has potential to be good, but when I received my food and cut into my burger, it was oozing blood....GROSS! I was so hungry, I ate about 3/4 of the first half, but couldn't do anymore, it was just so rare. When the gentleman came by to ask if I wanted a refill, I asked if the burgers a normally served rare/med rare like this?? He said that is medium and that us how we cook our burgers here. Clearly it is not medium, but whatever, customers should be made aware that the burgers are cooked to medium, not everyone likes a medium burger...me for one prefers my burgers well done, so you can imagine that I was not very happy with my $15 combo meal. I am not going to eat the other half, and I doubt I will be back. And it only gets one star because the fries and pink sauce are actually good.

I got the aussie burger with no pineapple. Idk why an Australian burger would have pineapple. Wouldn't that be Hawaiian?  
The burger was fine but having an egg and a steamed beat is a bit too much. I like beats as well as eggs but maybe not in my burger.  The fries were good. 

The service and location is good but the price is more expensive than wolfgang pucks restaurant at the mgm. The burger there is $16. This was approx $18. 
 
Sometimes simple is better when it comes to burgers.  Not sure I would come back here...
The pork ribs are meaty and delicious!  The coleslaw needs an overhaul and the red sauce should be the same as the sauce on the ribs.

My new favorite place for burgers! I ordered 'The Aussie Burger' and it was amazing! I left out the "egg" part just because I wasn't feeling it but it was delicious. By far my new favorite burger! The fries were ok. But all in all, loved the food & atmosphere. They even had a cute sink inside to wash your hands after your burgers or ribs!
Amazing staff , Food quality above standards , Always satisfying . Best place to go for a good American or Aussie Burger .

Unfortunately I came into this place last night to enjoy some ribs but got a very bad meal along with a waitstaff who could care less. I ordered the full slab of beef ribs only to get barely any meat on them and what was there was very tough/Tuff. My girlfriends meal was actually good and she enjoyed it. However after tell the waitress about my meal and that I was unsatisfied and how bad the ribs were, she said exactly these words " yeah I don't like those beef ones either, the other ones are better than those." WOW. Never brought over a manager.  Will not come back, gave an opportunity to fix or make it right, opportunity failed.

The worst service! I really wanted to try the place and my husband and I thought it would be a great place to eat near our home. So, we review the menu and order our food and paid the cashier. We walk over to the booth and sat down. After about 7 minutes or so a couple came with there 3 kids ordered and sat down. Keep in mind, it's about 12 minutes or longer. The cook places the order on the bar for the waitress to bring to us. Instead the waitress takes our order to the family that came after us. Now I am irritated! So, I asked the cook why did those people get there food before us when they came in after us? The cook states and I quote, "your food is ready!" I replied , Well..we didn't get so do I need to get my money back? A this point, I'm mad so I demanded my money back from the cashier. Here's the topper! The cashier tells me that the people that walked in 7 minutes after myself and my husband walked in that they had the same order as us. Now, this family walked in with 2 toddlers and a baby. So, I say to myself, what are you kidding me? I'm absolutely insulted because not only did order runner have a lame excuse but the manager didn't seem to care. I'd like to think that it was an honest mistake but I know that it wasn't. To seal the deal in this terrible establishment, they couldn't figure out how to give me a refund so I had to provide them with my receipt. And the copy they had was $3.00 less than the receipt they gave me. Word to the wise,  if your in the he market for ribs and burger, think twice because you will not get served if your skin is too dark.

Being a burger and ribs lover I wanted to really like this place but words can not express how bad this joint is, from the severely over-priced menu items, to the just dismal organization to the, quite possible, worst cooks in Vegas, this place was just a disaster from top to bottom. Maybe they will get better once they get more practice, it's only been open for two days, but unfortunately I'll never find out since I will never set foot in this place again. 

And I advice you don't either unless you want to overpay for a subpar meal.

Good luck Ribs & Burgers, although I think you'll need a whole lot more than luck.......
Understand why they make you pay first otherwise everyone would walk out. Has to be the slowest and most disorganized place in Vegas. Not to mention way overpriced for average food.

Wow!!!
Awesome service from general manager Brandon!! This is my moms favorite place because of the food. But now we'll be back because of Brandon! Thank you for making our night special

A little inconsistent with ordering the food and what you end up being served. Overall pretty good I had a problem with my salad and the manager gave my money back quickly. My husband ordered a side salad but was told he couldn't but the next table by us got a side salad. Good beer good wine flavor is good. Burgers look good. Give it some time I think they will make it

This place didn't disappoint! Food was really good and the staff was friendly and made sure we were taken care of. A burger runs about $10 everything is an add on. Your tab will climb fast. We had 2 burgers, fries and sodas and it was $32. I will definitely be back!

First time here and the first of many. One of those nights where we didn't feel like cooking and wanted to try one of the new restaurants at Downtown Summerlin. Ribs&Burgers looked like it would hit the spot. Service was prompt, two chefs asked how our meal was. We were comped a beer just because and they made shakes for my kids. The ribs are fall of the bone melt in your mouth delicious. The BBQ sauce was perfect and the sweet potato tots were amazing. Excellent food, excellent service. We will be back!!
Just not quality good food. Ribs fatty. Stale buns, burnt burger. The idea is better than the reality.

One word - Maple Bacon Donut Milkshake!


Here are some other words - delicious ribs and big cans of fosters!!!

Food and service are great!  They have a cool washing station in the middle of the establishment and plenty of tvs to catch your favorite game.  The main manager, I think his name is Carlos has great customer service.  Will definitely return...Aussie food at it's best!

Me and my wife came in for the first time and didn't know what to expect. The girl at the register was very friendly. We ordered and went to find a seat. She ordered a hamburger and fries and I ordered the ribs and sliders with fries combo. One chicken, and one beef slider. The food came out pretty quick. I asked for a side of ranch for my fries. We were surprised how great everything was. To have all the components taste great is pretty rare. Everything from the ranch that they make to the burgers and chicken slider and ribs was terrific. I had to tell the cooks they got everything right. We will definitely be back. And I almost forgot, the prices are very reasonable.

The food is delicious, presentation clever and service helpful and friendly. The lamb ribs are to die for, but we also loved the pork bullets and burger. The fries and onion strips are light and crispy. The meals can come with a side salad but I would like to see more vegetable entrees.

We stopped in for a drink and a snack while shopping.  We sat at the bar and were acknowledged quickly. The music was great but not too loud.  The place is clean and they even have a sink in the middle of the restaurant to wash your hands after! Staff was pleasant and attentive offering options and recommendations. The wings in the 'chilli' sauce were amazing as were the fries. Next time I want to try an adult milkshake. Brandon the GM was great!
This place is awesome. The food is amazing and the beer selection is good too. I love coming here for a bite to eat. The staff is always so friendly and welcoming.

I'm from California and have a lot of great burgers , and these ones are not the biggest but the quality of the meat is delicious. As for the ribs every time I try them at a restaurant and not my own backyard I'm always disappointed . From one pit master to another the ribs are on point, their cole slaw and fries are really good.

After reading the negative reviews about this restaurant I think the people who wrote those reviews are nuts! I've been here 4 times now and had excellent service and excellent food by people who actually care about what they serve in this restaurant. We have tried many different things and never been unhappy with anything. Give this place a try you will truly enjoy it even though there are other restaurants around this rib and burger place this place is excellent! Every time we've been here we've enjoyed the patio outside... what is better in Vegas great food and great scenery!
The Turkey Burger is amazing. The Ribs are incredible. However service can be slow on busy nights - but well worth the wait.

Burgers are a bit overpriced and they do not come with fries. The buns were a little dry and they seemed like they were bought at Smiths. A custom burger joint should have good buns. 

The ambience was nice and the customer service was average. I would go back to try the ribs, but there are better burgers out there for a lower price.

Overall it was a good experience. Overpriced due to the location I would say.

From being there the second night they were open, plus having a culture barrier, this place rocked. They were earnest in their service, never fake and had great attitudes. The flavour in their burgers was fantastic and juicy. The pork and lamb ribs were cooked to perfection; lamb ribs are rarely cooked with such accuracy.
(yes, I ordered and ate all this food...with a little help from my friends)

The biggest aspect they need to work on before being ready for an opening weekend in Vegas is cashier service time. After that, they need to keep the food warm from grill to table.

Price tag is not for the feint of heart. You are paying for quality meat.

The Cutie, my brother and I popped in before seeing Creed. Lunch menu, Pocket Combo, $10.  1/4 burger, Fries , Drink. Coke came in a glass with REAL ice cubes, not slush. All agreed, best burger, best fries, best Coke. Fries reminded me of McDonald's before they got corrected and they do come in quantity. Also saw some fried onion strings that made me think I missed something.
This is a very good place to eat a good burger and a lot of Ribs!!!! Rochelle is so helpful!! Awesome Customer Service!!!  I'll be back

What a disappointment! I was very excited to try this place with my family. It was my mother's birthday and she was craving a good gourmet burger and a beer. This place seemed to fit the bill. The food was not bad but definitely not worth price or terrible customer service. The guy and girl behind the counter looked miserable and had no people skills whatsoever. There was no friendly greeting when we stepped up to order, come to think of it, there was no greeting whatsoever. They reluctantly took are order as if the task was the biggest annoyance. I asked if there was any blue cheese to which I was told they only had american or swiss. Yet, my father's burger had feta cheese. I mentioned this to the runner who then brought me out a plastic container of feta cheese, thanks :/. My dad ordered a sprite and had to wait due to the carbonation needing to be changed, which is fine but no one let him know what was going on. When the counter girl brought part of our order, he asked if she was bringing his sprite to which she bluntly said "No." and acted as if he offended her by asking that. The manager was not much better, I was searching for the bathroom and instead of him asking me if I needed anything, he said "Hi?" Needless to say, there was no goodbye as we left, no "thanks for coming in!" It was as if we had imposed upon the entire staff by being there. Happy Birthday Mom!

I love ribs and always look forward to trying new options here in Las Vegas. For me, this restaurant was a big disappointment. I didn't like the fact that I had to order a full slab for myself. While the ribs were meaty, I didn't like their sauce, the very small portion of cole slaw was very salty and inedible. A soda was almost 3 dollars and since it was a bottle, there were no refills. It cost me over 29 dollars for my rib dinner....I will never go there again. I put 1 star because i had too, but i give it no stars.

We dont go to Downtown Summerlin much, but on this particular Saturday we went just to walk around. We had an array of cuisine to choose from, so we chose a very casual one. Their atmosphere is very cool.. very modern steampunk, with kitsch kitchen sinks so you can wash your hands. Their is a huge menu board so you can pick and choose what youre in the mood for. I wasnt really in the mood for a burger so I opted for the chicken wings. They were delicious! crispy on the outside and rreallllly moist inside. Their sauce wasnt overpowering and spicy. My favorite though, would have to be the cabbage salad. That was AMAZING! I looked around me and saw a glimpse of their burgers! They looked awesome as well! Needless to say, I am a fan of Ribs & Burgers- can't wait to try your burgers and shakes!

My wife and I stopped in here after a movie. The burgers were overpriced considering they did not come with fries, but they were good. It is like a cafeteria experience where you order food at the counter then find a seat. Very chaotic for a Friday night in downtown summerlin if you are a first time visitor and not familiar with the menu. Decent beer selection, but again over priced. Paid $8.11 for a pint of IPA not even a special run. Oh and I had to get up and get it myself. What is the sense of going out to eat here then???

Not a good choice for date night... I ordered the  WAGYU BURGER $18.50 and my husband PORK BABY BACK $30  my burger was terrible the meat was over cooked dry and tasteless not even adding A1sauce made a difference 
The baby back ribs were just ok. This whole meal was totally overpriced ... Note to myself just because its downtown Summerlin doesn't mean it has to be good!

Our best meal experience of the year in Las Vegas. We had been looking for an exceptional, meaty, mouth watering, succulent rib place for a while when we stumbled upon the brand new Ribs & Burgers at the Summerlin Mall. We found it here!
The hostess easily helped us pick out the meatiest ribs they have (pork short ribs). We weren't sure about all the beers, so she went the extra mile and gave us some samples in sample glasses. She helped bring our order to our table as well.
Within 15 minutes, our order arrived (see the pictures).
Mmm... delicious. We tried the sauces and preferred the BBQ with a tad of hot sauce thrown in. 
I was inquiring about the huge bone ribs that waiters were bringing to other tables. "Blue", one waiter then brought us a cow rib sample. Wow, also delicious!
The place was super clean, service excellent and timely, prices great for the quantity of the portions (we split the short pork ribs amongst the two of us). If you love ribs, I highly recommend Ribs & Burgers.

This place is amazing. The aussie burger is super bomb (hold the fried egg). Who knew beets on a burger would be so delicious?! It's a really cute place with awesome decor, the menu is small, but the contents are delicious!

Awful!  There were so many things wrong with this place I can't count. As other reviewers warned the menu is poorly placed to your back when ordering, there are no trays to carry your drinks to your table, which you have to do yourself, for water they give you a bathroom sized Dixie cup, you can buy water but it's Costco/Kroger bottled water, no fountain soda only skinny glass bottles of Coke and Sprite. 

Ordered the ribs "sauce on the side". And the kitchen thought that meant extra sauce on the side. They weren't bad ribs. Nice if you like something plain. 

We also got a cheeseburger, which came without French fries, and NO taste!  I was shocked that the title dish was so bad. The waitress was walking around and asked how my burger was. I said it had no taste and she said "sorry to hear that" and walked away. 

I can't imagine this place getting repeat business. We will not be returning.

Decent food. Horrible service. If I'm going to pay $50 for three burgers, I expect a higher level of service than fast food. I've had more attentive service at Burger King. No sense of urgency exhibited by any of the staff. I won't be back.

The place looks nice, and could be fun for a group either before or after a movie.  However, it was $46 for two of us (with a tip I wish I hadn't paid). 
At these prices they should be able to cook by burger to the proper temp. My medium rare burger came out well done. After sending it back, it came out closer to medium well. I didn't want to send it back two more times to get it closer to what I wanted. They also basted the party with some sort of BBQ sauce, although I specifically asked for no sauce on My burger.
My date's Salmon was another story. It originally came out way undercooked. The chef couldn't believe they sent it out like that. This soon attempt a better, but it was now 45 minutes from when we ordered.
After more than an hour we left with our half eaten meals.
I can't see returning unless I hear of major improvements to the food.
I will say that the staff was friendly, and seemed to want to make things better. However, if the kitchen can't get things out right, there isn't much the front of house can do.

I was one of the first 100 people for the opening of this place, so I ended up with a free burger once a week for a year. A good deal, but every time I stop by I just end up more and more disappointed.
    When we first got in, we got our burgers in a reasonable time, and they were reasonably tasty. Not bad, and I was glad I waited in line. Our second trip was a not very good. I ordered a chicken burger, and the flavor was majorly lacking. The Lemon and Herb seasoning on the chicken was nearly impossible to taste, and the lettuce was relatively dry. Our third and most recent time was an absolute mess. We walked in around 8:30, about a half hour from closing time. However, they refused to serve us, even though there was more than enough time to cook and serve us our orders. Not to mention the fact that the restaurant was relatively busy. It's one thing to close up shop ten minutes early if you aren't busy, but a casual dining restaurant that closes a half hour early? Talk about major disappointment. 
      The only reason I will continue to eat here is because it's free. I probably wouldn't spend money here, though.
Old skool burger is great.  Love the bun.  This place has only been open for three days and the place looks great.  TVs are needed for the games and I was told they were being installed tonight.

My boyfriend and I went here for lunch on Sunday, we both got bacon cheeseburgers and two cokes. The total? $30! And you don't even get french fries or anything. My boyfriend and I were both way let down by the taste and quality for the price. Our burgers had so much bbq sauce on it, it was kind of gross!

Not sure why this place isn't rated higher, their ribs are absolutely delicious, the sauce that comes on the side is nice and tangy, but the ribs are so tender they don't need it. The fries are crisp and fresh, and so, so good. Their burgers are juicy, probably some of the best. They aren't the cheapest burger joint in town but the quality and portion are worth it. Easily twice the portion of shake shack!

The place was nice, the food was good, I think is a little over price for having to stand in line and order your own food. Luckily there was no line because 10 minutes after, I could see customers frustration for having to wait to get to the Menu board and then wait to pay before you sit down. The sink in the middle of the restaurant is a good idea but I would hate to be sitting right by it and have somebody splash me while they wash their bbq sauce off their hands. That's why I generously rate it a 3 stars.

Love love love love!!
Came in with my parents and husband. 
We all ordered full slabs of babyback ribs with fries and beers. The front staff was amazing.
The kitchen was efficient. Our food came out very quickly. 
Everything was amazing!!!
We ate on the patio since it's a seat yourself kind of place.make sure to order at the counter first.

 We will be back. Loved everything!

This place is awesome! We have been here several times and have never had a bad experience. I love the burgers and fries, and my boyfriend has fallen in love with the beef ribs. As awesome as the food is, the staff is just as amazing. Everyone is friendly and helpful and very personable. Blue is one of the managers and he went out of his way to give us a great experience just because he seems like a genuinely nice person. He even let us try the pork bullets just because we mentioned we enjoy pork ribs. If you go here and don't have an amazing experience, you're doing something wrong!

I like the look and feel of the restaurant and the servers were very friendly. I ordered a burger and sweet potatoes.. Loved the potatoes and still enjoyed my burger even tho it was overcooked (I like mine medium rare). I'm going back to try the ribs :)
Run of the mill burger,  just ok.  Nothing amazing.  Definitely not like the pictures they have outside when your walking through the side walk.  It's more like a fancy fast good.

We were in downtown summerlin because the weather is good and we were just looking for something good to eat. Came to this place and was wanting to order some beef ribs, while ordering chef Adrian came by and said that their pork ribs are way better than the beef ribs because they only have the rib tips, I said it's okay, I'd still order some, he recommended that if I like tender meat it wouldn't be that tender, so I went ahead and order the pork ribs since that's what he recommended. He then told me that he'll give me a sample of their beef ribs with the pork ribs. The pork ribs was delicious, my girlfriend order their most basic burger and she said it was good and pretty cheap too. While I was eating I forgot that chef Adrian was supposed to give me sample of their beef ribs. He came out with an order of the beef ribs which I tried and he was right, if you like tender meat most likely you're not gonna like it. He gave me a whole order of the ribs for free for me to try. The customer service in this place is phenomenal, specially after dealing with Adrian, would definitely come back here for their food but more because of the service. He also came and visited our table multiple times just to check if I liked to food.

Man this place should be packed!..Ribs (pork) are tender and the sauce is on point. Sliders were great and this is probably the best shake in town (Oreo).. Staff is friendly and they have cool music playing... Great vibe and good people watching..They also have need and lamb Ribs which I was assured were just as good. I'm not adventurous to try the lamb Ribs but someone else might. There is also alcoholic shakes along with beer/wine

So, I was one of the first 100 people in line for this joint. That means that I won a free burger a week for a year. A pretty good deal for waiting outside overnight. Unfortunately, each time I go to this place, there is one more thing to complain about. 

The first time we went was great! The burger tasted good, although that may have been because of staying up all night with only small snacks to munch on periodically. Regardless! Our order was taken, the staff was friendly, and we received our food promptly and hot. 

The second time, we got our food a little bit slower. I ended up upgrading my free burger to the Salmon burger. I did not care for it. At all. It wasn't cooked badly, it just had a weird combination of ingredients. Capers and teriyaki sauce do NOT go together. Plus, the fish was abnormally fishy. Also, the milkshake we ordered took an unnecessary amount of time to get to our table. My boyfriend had to go up and ask for it and he was the one who ended up bringing it back. 

Tonight was the most recent time we visited Ribs & Burgers. We arrived slightly later than we wanted to and got there at 8:30, which should be fine considering they close at 9. Well, it was a problem. They refused to serve us despite the restaurant being full of individuals eating their meals. Apparently, closing at 9 means they stop serving people at 8:30, which is ridiculous for a restaurant. We traveled all the way to Downtown Summerlin just to eat at Ribs & Burgers and ended up leaving empty handed. Very unprofessional. 

Obviously, we'll be back because of our free burger card, but I probably wouldn't be back here except on occasion for the milkshakes. Can't pass up a milkshake.

UPDATE: Been back a few more times and service is getting progressively better. A friend of mine works here and said they had some communication problems at the beginning but they're getting better each day. I think he's right because my food has been getting to me a lot faster and a waitress I had the other day was very prompt. Moving my stars up from 2 to 3. Let's hope they had a bad case of New Restaurant Blues and they keep improving from here on out.

Was in the mood for a restaurant style burger and this did not disappoint. 
Stopped by this place while walking around Downtown Summerlin. 
The interior was cool, clean, and very open. Love how they have a sink in the middle of the restaurant near the ketchup section (did not use, but I appreciate unique details). 

Downtown Summerlin offers free-wifi so I was able to handle business quickly on my macbook while waiting for the food.

Staff and service was very inviting and accommodating. (I had an adventurous two year old with me so they are kid-friendly).

Ordered the Pocket burger, drink, and fries. They give you a little bucket with your table number on the outside that holds napkins, fry sauce, ketcup, etc. It was a beautiful day so we decided to eat on the patio. Food came fairly quick (thankfully as I was anxious to eat). 


For it to be called a pocket burger, it was pretty big. Fries were amazing and crisp. Really enjoyed the fry sauce paired with the burger and of course, the fries. More than likely will come back to try the other items on the menu.

I was pleasantly surprised with my experience at this new Downtown Summerlin restaurant. After numerous unfavorable reviews, I had to find out what the fuss was all about. I came in for lunch, looked over the menu that hung just inside the door, and paid for my meal before having a seat. There are no servers per say at Ribs & Burgers. The hostess is a cashier and the one who makes the delicious shakes. The chefs make the food and deliver it to your table. You are given a tin of silverware/napkins and a table number for the chef to locate the correct table with the right meal.

I ordered a chicken sandwich. He ordered a Greek salad with chicken. My chicken sandwich had a zesty lemon flavor. It was very good! The Greek salad looked amazing, so I had a couple bites of that too. The salad had an excellent flavor - the vegetables were fresh and lettuce was crisp. Chef Cliff brought out some French fries for us to sample with our meal. This was a hit! The fries were crispy, hot, lightly salted, and delicious. 

We enjoyed the atmosphere while we ate. Then, following our meal we had our alcoholic s'more milkshake. Wow, that milkshake is a phenomenal experience of flavors! It was so good that I even took one to go.  I am sure it was like a billion calories too!

The restaurant was clean, staff was polite, and I enjoyed my experience.  I will come again!

This place is incredible. I ordered the aussie burger which has egg and pineapple included. One of the best meals I've ever had. Service was friendly and personable, it was a quiet night and the chef walked us through the entire menu. 5/5 any day. Would come back every time I visit las vegas.
I come for one thing and that's the ribs. I was not disappointed at all. They were juicy and meaty...so delicious.  Service..eh...

I don't know why I am writing this review - based on my experience and other reviews; this place will be out of business in 4 months.

First you walk in, the menu is on a big chalkboard opposite of the register. There is no menu behind the cashier. So when you are trying to order, you are talking away from the cashier and trying to look over other customers' shoulders. BIG MISTAKE. Please print some paper menus for customers to look at while in line. PUT A COPY OF THE MENU BOARD BEHIND THE CASHIER SO YOUR CUSTOMERS CAN TALK TO YOUR CASHIER. It seems that your cashiers are having a hard enough time as it is.

As I am ordering, someone in a half-tucked in blue button-up shirt (manager?) is hovering over her to make sure she types in everything correctly. Very uncomfortable. 

I order a whole rack of ribs w/ fries, extra side salad, a burger, and two waters. I am handed two room-temperature COSTCO/KIRKLAND brand waters and a bucket with number on the side of it. Just under $40.00.

** Do not insult your customers by serving generic $2.50 a case water and charging $2.00 per bottle for it. At least get a brand name in there or label your own. **

** I was not asked how I wanted the burger cooked, very odd for a $15.00 burger **

** I did not get an itemized receipt **

I sit down in a half-booth / half chair seat located directly behind the kitchen at 6:50pm.

We wait.

We notice what we think is our food come up in the kitchen and watch it get delivered to another table.

They complain to the manager that they didn't order a salad (we ordered the salad). The manager (in all black) brings them more fries.

We give them the benefit of the doubt and wait.

And wait.

It is now 7:25. 35 minutes after we paid and sat down.

We notice a couple that was standing behind us has already finished their meal.

I go up to the cashier and ask what is going on ??

The manager (all black) ignores me and the head cook comes to talk to me. I explain the problem.

He talks to a waitress 4 feet away from me. She tells the cook that she mis-deleivered the food to the party of 6 behind us. She digs out our ticket that she had already punched. She explains that she forgot to replace our order.

The cook then comes back to me and LIES STRAIGHT TO MY FACE. He tells me that they couldn't find our bucket and assumed that we left. He accused us of leaving !!! He said our food was given to someone else because we had left.

WE NEVER LEFT !??! WE WERE SITTING RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE KITCHEN THE ENTIRE TIME ! 

HOW MANY PEOPLE JUST LEAVE AFTER PAYING $40.00 FOR FOOD ? ARE YOU SERIOUS ? I JUST HEARD YOUR WAITRESS TELL THE COOK THAT SHE MIS-DELIEVERED IT TO THE PARTY OF 6 !!!

It is now 40 minutes since we ordered. I ask for a refund. I show him my receipt and he tells me that "this doesn't help, it doesn't show me what you ordered". I tell him, that is all you gave me, you didn't give me an itemized receipt". 

The cook can't figure out how to do the refund to a credit card. He panics and starts yelling at the kitchen to not put my order on. They STILL had not even started my replacement order after 40 minutes ! 

The cook asks the manager how to do the refund and the manager barks at him "just give him cash and get him out of here - do what you need to do". They didn't have enough cash in both registers for our refund so we ended up with over $2.00 in nickels and dimes. 

The entire time I was watching the kitchen I noticed multiple orders come back as incorrect and the kitchen staff yelling at the servers. Very unprofessional when you have customers listening 5 feet away.

I urge the management and owner to have lunch at a food truck or any fast food restaurant today (McDs, Del Taco, Taco Bell) so that they can understand how to take an order and how to serve an accurate order on time. If things don't change, I don't expect this place to be in the directory the next time the Downtown Summerlin re-prints it.

Free Wi-Fi didn't work and there were no outdoor heaters.

We were shopping around downtown Summerlin with my parents who are here visiting and decided some burgers sounded good. As soon as we stepped inside, we were greeted with excellent service, answering all the questions we had about the items, and even telling us their suggestions. My husband and I both ended up ordering the Old skool burger, which is a  beef patty, American cheese, mustard, pickles, BBQ & home-made aioli, we got it without onions. It was very juicy and full of flavor. Also got a side of fries, and they were seasoned perfectly and tasted great. My dad ordered the lamb burger, which consists of a lamb patty, tomato, arugula, feta, Spanish onion and tzatziki. He added carmelized onions. He really likes lamb but doesn't normally get a chance to try it many places. He said is was really good and ate the whole thing.  My mom ended up getting the Chicken breast basted with lemon & Herb w/ Aioli. This consists of two breasts. She loved the flavor and it was cooked perfectly. She also ordered a side of cabbage salad, which she realized she wasn't a fan of, and the sweet potato tots, which she thought were incredible. I tried them, I don't normally like sweet potato things, and I thought they tasted pretty dang good. All the food tasted great, the service was speedy and friendly, and I am a fan of the decor. We will be returning here in the future.

Sick to my stomach!!! We went to try this restaurant out today and were really excited to have their wagyu burger. Wow we are disappointed!! I asked for well done burger and the guy who took my order assured me it would be well done "no pink or red to worry about." Guess what half way to my burger pink raw uncooked meat. That wasn't even the worst part. The worst part was the bun which was covered in flour and tasted like I was eating raw dough. After paying $14 for a burger and $4.50 for large fries which were so soggy and dripping of oil (gross). I am very disappointed and recommend everyone to try somewhere else. I have posted a picture of my disgusting burger.

We love this place! Love the atmosphere and everyone has been pleasant. Even though you're not waited on, there's usually someone offering to refill my drink which I LOVE and appreciate since it's not self-service even when you get up to refill it. The sweet potato tots are my all-time favorite.

I had the Aussie burger, which was awesome, and the sweet potato tots, which were awful.

I'll start with the burger! Great burger. Really well cooked, well seasoned, toppings were good and flavor was pretty solid. Overall, I'd give the burger a 5 star if that were all I'd eaten here. Don't be afraid of the beetroot on the Aussie burger. Take a chance. It's actually amazing. I ordered mine "naked" (no bun) and it came out wrapped in a huge amount of lettuce. It was quite difficult to eat -- as most all lettuce-wrapped burgers are! -- but was worth it. I'd have this burger again in a heartbeat.

The downside to my visit was definitely the sweet potato tots. I am a big sweet potato fan, and I'm 99% sure that these tots have sugar in them. They were *extremely* sweet, and just terrible. They were *far* too sweet to eat on their own, and they clashed with the flavors of all the sauces available. My wife agreed. We threw them all away after trying and failing to find a good way to eat them. 

Too bad about the tots. I was really excited to try them as a healthy alternative to regular fries. 

Overall assessment: I'll be back again for burgers, and I still need to try the ribs, but the tots are a big no-go.
Always an excellent burger made from fresh meat. The fries are also fantastic. My son thinks it is "The Best"

Another successful dinning event at Ribs & Burgers in Downtown Summerlin.  We brought in a party of 16 people.  It was a beautiful evening so we opted to sit outside on their patio.  The patio is very clean and surprisingly quiet.  The food quality at Ribs & Burgers is amazing.  I love the baby back ribs.  The employees are so friendly and the manager, Brandon, was very accommodating and made sure that we were well taken care of.  Everyone in our party had only good things to say about Ribs & Burgers.  They prepare your food in an open kitchen where you can watch.  This is not our first time here and it certainly won't be our last.  I highly recommend Burgers & Ribs in Downtown Summerlin.

With a new burger joint, I start with a classic before I venture out on the menu. Had the Original with Swiss and bacon. Great chargrilled taste to the big patty. Veggies were fresh and crunchy. Buns were sweet and perfect, didn't fall apart at all. I believe the veggies go on top and meat on bottom, so I ate it upside down. As a classic burger, it couldn't be much better. I'll be back to explore the other styles! Great service. Good selection of beers.

My sister, boyfriend, and I were really hungry and decided to go to Downtown Summerlin for dinner. When we saw that this place had finally opened, we were really excited to try it out. We had to walk in to see the menu - it was writen on a giant chalkboard. At first glance, I thought it was kind of overpriced. Also, I can only imagine people gawking at the menu inside causing a huge line of some sort. I predict being annoyed at waiting and just walking to some other place to eat. Upon ordering, they don't have normal soda and you have to pay for water. This is seriously a place you eat after shopping a little, not a fancy restaurant so I was shocked that you had to pay for water. Once done ordering, you get a bucket full of utensils and you can sit wherever you want. 

We got the full rack of ribs (they don't have a half slab option), angus burger, and steak sandwich. For the price of the burger and steak sandwich, you get no sides. I felt like you should get some type of side, but you have to order it separately. The full slab of ribs came with like...15 french fries though lol. Oh, you also get cole slaw with the ribs, but they forgot. We had to go up there and remind them twice. Overall, the food was alright. It wasnt' hot just room temperature? I guess. This place was just not for me. The interior design is really pretty though! 

I don't plan on coming here again unless I have to.

I came here once before and it was the best burger I ever had, so of course I came back. This time around, the service seriously lacked. I had to walk and find people just to find a fork because they didn't give us utensils. Also, they served me raw meat. They say that everything is cooked medium unless otherwise preferred. However, my burger was completely raw. Probably seared for 2 seconds on each side then plopped onto my burger. The texture was mushy, UNCOOKED raw meat. This location is moving so I just won't ever be back anyways. And I don't plan on finding their new location.

***UPDATE: the manager handled the situation very nicely. I just felt so disgusted after investigating the burger that I needed to say something so that nobody else would get the same quality, they just need to pay a little closer attention. The manager gave me NO problems, no hassle, simply refunded me for the burger and apologized for the situation. Makes me feel a lot better about everything. Very happy with the professionalism.

Aussie burgers, Aussie ribs, Aussie beer, oi! oi! oi!  The lamb ribs are frickin' delicious and my juicy burger was, too. Some kinks to work out as a new business, but I'll be back to try more menu items soon, no doubt about it.

FOOD: Menu is burgers and ribs. Duh. The aforementioned lamb ribs are what they recommend most, and with damn good reason. They're flavorful, they're juicy, they taste great. The Old Skool burger (American, mustard, pickles, onion, BBQ, and aioli) is classic, juicy perfection. Meats are really good quality, cooked just right. 

BEVERAGES: Wine, beer, "craft bottled sodas" and Fiji water available only. We were told tap water wasn't available yet the table next to us was offered some after they finished their beers. Other tables had a (probably lower-priced) generic water bottle yet we weren't offered other options than the small, room-temperature Fiji. Not really a fan of the inconsistency, just let me have iced water. Snag a can of Fosters to keep the Aussie spirit flowing.

SERVICE: Mostly friendly staff, management welcoming folks at the door, that's what I like to see! Line at door was backed up, moved slowly. Guy at register was easily distracted and took several minutes to take our simple order. Food took 40+ minutes to come out, I won't count this against them unless it's still that backed up when I return in a month. Expediting and streamlining the kitchen takes time with a new business, I get that.

PRICING: For the few other reviews whining about pricing, ribs are not budget food in the first place. The $18 rack of lamb was priced just right, IMO. Burger was under $10 but some went up to about $14. Still not outlandish, our dinner was right over $30. Considering the other options in this area AND the quality, they're not overpriced.

Trying the lamb burger and the beef ribs on our next visit, hoping for a seat on the patio while the weather is still nice. The rustic-farmhouse décor is modern and clean, old school kitchen sink in the middle of the dining room is quirky and functional.

I walked in and was greeted by a friendly lady. It was my first time here so she told me how the system works. When you walk in you see a huge menu much just choose what you want to order the front counter, pay etc and then we pretty much just choose if we would like to sit inside or outside. First let me just say that the whole look of the restaurant is very nice, we were very impressed when we walked in the staff; cooks and the waiters are extremely friendly, made sure that we were good the entire time we were there but didn't do to much. We both ordered burgers and they were juicy any extremely delicious so we definitely would recommend the burgers. Also they look amazing lol. I have nothing bad to say about this place. It is a very beautiful place and we really liked it and definitely would recommend anyone to come here.

HOW RUDE!! I was here today and am DUMBFOUNDED how the owner approached a family with a beautiful little daughter.  She was standing on the seat singing a lovely little song HE TOLD THEM TO LEAVE cuz he was more worried about his stupid bench than his family-friendly environment   If your kids are statues I guess this place is good for you. The food is so so but One star cuz I can't give ZERO.
Sucks they closed... Their Aussie Burger had to be best burger Ive eaten since EVER. BRING THEM BACK!

I'm happy to say the nasty sulfur smell is gone. At least it was yesterday!  hubby had the steak burger, and well..... I didn't get to try a bite because he ate it so quick. I had the lemon aioli chicken burger. It was really yummy. I Love That the fries come piping hot. One thing I still dislike is that I had to go up to get a refill. If it was a self service place that's fine, but I had to awkwardly wait for a server to see me to get a refill and the waiters weren't attentive enough to do it for you. My hubby was offered one when his drink got low, but I'm a nursing mom, I got to drink a lot. The chef was there yesterday, he had great energy and made the guests feel real welcome. I thought that was nice. I do think they should consider adding a bigger menu board on the right wall right when you walk in so that more people can look at it. Or even have a menu outside in a few places.

Wow! What an amazing place to eat! The burgers are the best I have ever eaten! My husband got the ribs and they were so good, we ordered a whole rack to take home. Great friendly staff and the owner was talking to everyone in line and at the tables. (Nice touch) there is patio seating and the location is great. Just an all around good dinning experience. We would recommend this eatery to everyone. Almost forgot the  sink in the middle of the restaurant! I had sticky rib fingers and was going to go to the bathroom to wash them but...LOW AND BEHOLD...a sink with all the amenities! That was GREAT!

The food was fairly average, the customer service was bad.  
I agree with a previous reviewer who mentioned the woman working at the register.  I did not get her name but I have to assume (or hope-could multiple employees be like this?) that this was the same woman.  She acted completely disinterested to the point of being rude.  My husband greeted her kindly/like a normal human being and she just barely acknowledged him.  Throughout our order, she behaved as if we were inconveniencing her by ordering food.  I am confused why she chooses to work there, as she seems to really hate it.  
To the owners, this is not the kind of employee you want to be the first person your customers come in contact with.  Actually, probably shouldn't want someone acting like this to ever interact with your customers if you want them to come back.  We just chalked it up to her being an unhappy person, and unconcerned about the quality of her work.
As stated above, the food was mostly average in quality and flavor.  The burger was disappointingly bland, but I do like that you are able to get both ribs and burgers on the same plate.  No need to decide which one to get!  Still, both the sliders and the ribs were lacking in flavor.  Overall, the whole meal was slightly sweet.  Would have been great to have something spicy or acidic to balance it all out.  Maybe I should have gotten the slaw instead of the fries!
Sadly though, I will not be going back to see if that makes any difference.  The food didn't leave much of an impression and the staff left a bad one.
Had the Wagyu $14 burger....horrible!!! Way over cooked & was not "gourmet" by any means!!! Can't see this place lasting for what they charge for burnt burgers. Should have went to Five Guys!

Having heard good verbal reviews my friend and I decided to try Ribs & Burgers while at Downtown Summerlin.  While not a fan of counter ordering the small, casual rib joint was not busy on a Friday evening. That definitely changed by the time we left. Customers were lined up to order and all tables were full.
After reviewing the chalkboard menu by the door we ordered the pork baby back slab to share. It was 110 outside so we wanted to eat light.  A few hearty souls even sat on the patio.
When we were served we very surprised at the meaty portion of ribs and the piping hot fries.  The sauces were pleasant that came in a teakettle with napkins and utensils. The delicious smoky flavor of the ribs with the moist and tender meat was a big surprise. Such a small restaurant just served us the best ribs in town! The single $24 portion left us full and happy.
Try it. You will like it. The steak burger and wagyu burger served next to us looked large and were tasty according to those diners. While everyone's tastes are different I was left questioning the other reviews I read here. Simple, good food, pleasant service for $30.  My buddy and I will be back.

Brought the family here for the 1st Time .. Great service and the burgers are on point ! Not really sure what the bad reviews are about . The assistant manager Michael Ryan , chef Adrian, Joe & Jen the hostess are awesome ! Rarely write reviews but this place deserves more credit than the bs that's written about it . Come here & try it

Great taste... Burger was ordered medium rare & came out way past well done. And comically it was still good. I did not eat the bun, but my friend did & she raved about it.  
The pink sauce is very good & the pickles were crisp & had a great flavor. 
We got some nice advice from a man standing by the front door who greets people and answers questions.  
Just be very repetitive about the temperature you want. Maybe even tell them you read a review that they over cook the burgers, as I asked two times to make sure it was going to be medium rare. Next time I am ordering raw. Lol
They have bottled Cream Soda. Heaven

The Skinny: so-so food served lukewarm if not room temperature (2.5) service: poor organization and set up makes for substandard service(2) value: high prices for below average quality makes this a pass...plus they do not even offer tap water and only offer expensive small bottles of Fiji water(2).

Let me preface this review with the fact that my husband ordered the food and I joined him later once the food had arrived. 

He was really enthused about this place opening so close to home. Hungering for burgers he came earlier when they opened but was dissuaded from eating there for lunch due to all the people lined up for Opening day offer of free burgers for a year for the first 100 people. 

So he decided we would do dinner with a friend of ours.

Initially when he entered the restaurant,  it was unclear how to order as there is no hostess to greet you.  The way the restaurant is set up,  it appears as if it ought be sit down service. But after a while they figured that it was counter service. 

So they go up to the counter to order and pay.They were a little weirded out by the large basket of non-packaged straws was sitting there at the counter. Not to mention condiments are located right next the wash sink in the middle of the restaurant (see photos). We liked the concept of the sink but do not like the fact that the condiments are in a splash zone. 

In addition to all the weird set up,  they also will not serve you tap water. Your only options are overpriced small bottles of Fiji,  sodas or other beverages. 

Anyway,  we ordered the lamb burger ($14),  kale salad ($8), and a rack of ribs ($24, comes with fries and coleslaw). 

The lamb burger was definitely only so-so in my book. The patty was rather thin compared to the bun.  The tzaziki/hummus flavor really overwhelmed the taste of the underseasoned,  dry, lamb patty. FYI - For a burger joint that charges the prices they do,  they do not ask how you liked your burger cooked (ie, medium well, well done,  etc.). 

Rack of ribs were decidedly meh. There wasn't enough smoky flavor and the meat was not tender enough. It was a bit pretty sad state for the ribs. The coleslaw was too salty for me and slathered with too much mayo. Normally,  I love coleslaw but even I could tolerate only one bite of it. Fries were okay and not really anything special. 

Kale salad was rather uninspiring.  The creamy dressing seemed rather bland and definitely needed some acidity to brighten the flavor. The blanched almonds, green beans,  apple and cranberries appeared as an after thought rather than as an integral part of the salad.

In terms of the service,  the burger and ribs were lukewarm and not hot enough. My hubs and friend had to ask twice for our fries which were missing for a while. The manager finally noticed and comped us an extra serving of fries which was nice of him. 

Granted that we did go opening day,  Ribs and Burgers has a lot of issues to iron out in terms of execution, service and organization. In terms of value and quality, $50 for what we got seemed very overpriced. (2 starred review).
Yummy!  Wanted a quick bite before the movies and have walked by this place many times so gave it a try.  I had the Turkey Burger, Hubs the ribs.  Both really good!  Fries were crispy and perfect.

I've been waiting for this place to open since November.  Since it finally opened Tuesday, we decided to wait a couple of days and headed over on a Sunday afternoon.  

We ordered the lamb burger, the salmon burger, two drinks and a plate of fries.  First of all, I though everything tasted very good.  Fries were great, salmon burger was great, but the lamb burger was overdone for my taste.  The cons; get a damn soda fountain.  I understand when the only option is a bottled soda if I'm on the strip or if I'm at some high priced restaurant.  Not for a burger joint.  I think that's just ridiculous especially for 3.50 each.  Come on, now.  Also, our fries were brought out about fifteen minutes before our actual food but they noticed this and brought us extra.  I had no issues with the service but would recommend putting up an additional menu or having some to hand out so the line doesn't get backed up when people are waiting to order.

I'm not sure if I'd go back.  The soda thing is a real point of contention for me.  Good burgers but not something that I couldn't find elsewhere or make myself.

Great service all around! Atmosphere is really nice inside and out. They have inside and patio seating. Somewhat small seating space inside. Wife and I saw a special on a sign for 2 burgers, 2 fries, and 2 drinks for $25 and figured we would try it. Food was excellent. Saw a picture of a bigger and thought no way would it look that way. To my astonishment, it really did look exactly like the picture. We are definitely planning on eating here again. Ribs look great so we will be trying those next time around. Think I saw a plate that featured sliders and half rack or ribs. 

I do believe the Managers name I spoke with was Brandon. He was awesome. Wasn't afraid to get his hands dirty. Noticed him getting drinks & delivering food to tables. Also saw him motivate the employees and thank them for their teamwork. Great job to everyone there. Definitely recommend eating here.
Burger is one of the best I've ever had. Fries were good too. Haven't tried the ribs.

This was great! You walk in check out the menu and order, easy as that my wife and I both chose a burger I got the Australian and she the original. They were both perfectly cooked to order. Also they give you a bucket with fry and BBQ Sauce. The service was great they refilled drinks with out us asking. Over all it was a fantastic meal and a great relaxing place to sit and take a break from shopping.

Bummer & Hopin  they are able to get it together, no menu knowledge by most we asked and including the cashier that it took 3 different people and 12 mins to ring up food w/o a line? small portions, average fries & burgers at best, burgers do not come as ordered. Ribs where good, you must enjoy thick sweet BBQ. Seems like several families operating & serving. Service was none extant. $10 for 4-5 oz's of wine

Fantastic restaurant. Great staff! Manager (Carlos) was awesome and Roshell provided amazing service. Will definitely revisit!  

It's a new concept restaurant, Americans are not open to trying new restaurants and understanding different cuisines. This restaurant resembles the Australian cuisine and it was absolutely awesome!

We came here for my sister in law's birthday.  Food and staff were excellent!!  Will definitely come back for sure!  Most of our party had the Aussie burger, I had the original with Swiss cheese and bacon.  I have to say that this is one of the best burgers I've ever had!  Didn't care for the sweet potato tots that we all shared but that's more me probably not caring for sweet potatoes in general.  I don't remember the names but the cashier was a Hawaiian gentleman.  Super helpful and staff was still great even though we came there close to their closing time.

First time here, was not impressed. The girl at the counter had her back to us and was cleaning glasses. When she finally turned around and acknowledged us the first thing she said was, "are you ready to order?". Not hello. Really made me feel like I was bothering her. Then I ordered two cheeseburger meals specifically with no sauce. Both came with sauce. Ordered sweet potato tots but they were out. It was only 3 in the afternoon. The food was mediocre. The French fries are better at burger king. It was basically overpriced fast food. Step up your game.

Came here with my boyfriend. Food is great, but the prices for the portions aren't too worth it, but it's kinda expected in that area.
We split a butcher block salad, not too sure on the name, very fresh but the dressing was super light and almost non-existent 
Had the lamb burger, very tasty but needed more salt.
He got the lamb rack and two slider combo. Wasn't too impressed with the ribs just because there were so many bones but I am guessing that's because of the cut. The french fries were actually really good though.
If you don't mind spending a little more I would recommend coming here but don't expect a feast.

Decent ribs, burgers, and beers and reasonable prices. The food is good, the service is less so. You line up to place your order. With only three people in front of us, we waited more than 20 to place our order, then another 20 before we received our drinks. We only had 2 napkins in our bucket of utensils and had to ask 3 times for another for our third person. Same deal for mustard and a knife. Onion strings were the best part of the meal. Everything was good, but not worth the hassle.

The chicken sliders were amazing it's too bad that people will not give a new restaurant a break when they first open ,give them a shot again ,and give them 4 to 5 stars they deserve it!!! The food was awesome! Chicken sliders! Are awesome and for u skinny chicks! No buns! Ribs were awesome! Give them a shot!

Cool concept and smart service programs. Burgers are solid for the price ( had the Wagyu ). Baby back ribs were tender unfortunately not smoked and a little cold on the bone. Missed my sides etc but I'll go back as the team there is enthusiastic to say the least Fin Du Monde on tap..

I believe the wooden tables were cleaned, but they were quite sticky. The bathrooms required attention, including having toilet paper available. The floors were dirty with food and slick especially by the restroom and the food prep area. 

The food tasted great. However we asked for the kid burgers to be well done and they were not; the kids did not eat their full meal due to the redness. The staff was extremely friendly and tried to be attentive.

The price seemed reasonable.

The food here is amazing. The burgers we ordered were juicy and tasted very fresh. The fries were also great. The interior is small and cute. The only downside to this place for me is that they do not really offer soda from a soda fountain. They only have craft (bottled) sodas or beer.  That is the reason it is not 5 star review.

The food here is definitely worth paying the price! I had the Kobe burger and my husband got the lamb burger. They were both cooked to perfection! We enjoy going to new place and this was an absolute treat! I can't wait to try their rack of ribs next time!

Nice setting...smells great. So weird but cool they have a sink in the middle of the restaurant next to condiments to wash your hands.
Okay down to business! Burgers were nothing special actually pretty disappointed.
 I ordered the Wagyu(or they say!). I get it well done when I ordered it medium. It was so dry I had to bury it in their bbq sauce, which the sauce was good I might add. So back to the meat, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference if it was regular beef, Wagyu, or anything else! I was surprised to see other reviews saying how good this place was. Maybe the chef was having a bad day.
Oh my toddler had the slider....not good at all! The meat was so dense my son was chewing for like an hour and washing it down with lemonade. This is the First time he  asked for 3 refills while trying to finish a small burger!
Service was alright nice that they come around and offer to get refills. Fries were good but nothing amazing.
Sorry guys need to do better at the prices you set your food!

First time here and the wife and I order the burger and lam ribs. We were blowing away! By far the best Lamb Ribs and burger we ever ate! And we've tried a lot of burger and rib places. The fries, sweet potato tots were amazing too. Great service and excellent food. Must try! We'll definitely be coming back once or twice a month.

Was out in Summerlin today and decided to try a new place. We stopped in at Ribs & Burgers. Menu looked interesting so we decided to try the sliders and ribs combo.  Place was not busy and all the tables were dirty. I wiped off our table and we waited for our food. Food came after a short wait.  My hamburger slider was done correctly but very messy.  My wife's chicken slider was ordered plain but came with a mustard sauce, but she pressed on.  Her chicken was cooked through, but not hot.  The ribs were cooked, but barely warm. There wasn't much flavor either. Bbq sauce was nothing special All in all, the burger was decent but the rest of the meal was sub par. On a positive note the staff were friendly and service was above average.
Great ribs and beef/chicken sliders platter, Wagyu burger, and excellent service! Brandon understands the value of serving good food and making customers feel valued. Will definitely be back soon.

bad
menu in bad place 
bottled drinks
ribs were fatty
expensive
its scary u have to ask for glass of ice and then u need to get your own water

this place has no future 

mgr even offered my money back
did not take it as i would have felt i needed to come back

It was ok, not really worth the price tag in my opinion. The milkshake was the consistency of watery soup... it tasted ok but c'mon! The fries were decent. They obviously Refilled their "Heinz" ketchup bottles with cheap ketchup because it tasted terrible. For the price I paid I wish I would have gone elsewhere. The service was pretty friendly though.

Besides the typical new restaurant glitches,  food was very good and a nice/cool inside.  Owners/managers very attentive to guests to make sure everyone is happy... We had the pork bullets, sliders, salad and sides.  All three of my kids and wife were happy.  Lots of lemon flavored in the sauce, which I like but not my wife's favorite.
Michael is a fabulous chef! Thank you! Juicy and delicious red meat. And I don't even eat red meat.

The French fries are good, try the thousand island colored sauce on the table with your fries, delicious. I have tried the chopped chicken salad and it was extremely delicious with a very light dressing.

Got a carry out order on 5/8/15, The place has been open just a few weeks so they're working out some minor glitches which should be fixed quickly. My complaints end there. The food was awesome, probably some of the best Ribs I've had here in Las Vegas. The staff is attentive and make sure the orders are 100% correct. The owner is committed to making the place a success and other than the minor technical glitch which does happen to new businesses (Had to do with computer system, not the product) was a great experience. I suggest if you're at Summerlyn Place, check them out. They have a customer in me for sure.

Second time here and it was excellent. Friendly staff and great burgers. Kind of pricey but look here you are. 

Purchased an original burger large fry, corona, a pocket deal with a grand total of 35 bucks. 

Great burgers and atmosphere

This place has a cool food concept. Who doesn't like ribs? And, who doesn't like burgers? The fact that it is located in Downtown Summerlin, surrounded by lots of shopping, makes it seem that much more appealing. But, I would not go back here or take anyone from out of town here. The atmosphere was great, the staff was amazing, the food was so mediocre. If it was cheap, maybe it would be doable, but it wasn't cheap at all. You pay a lot for ribs that are very tiny. They were somewhat flavorful, but I think that if you are going to reference ribs in your restaurant name, they better be damn good! The burger sliders were just OK, too dry and plain for my taste. The best thing here were the fries and the hand washing station in the middle of the restaurant. Maybe they'll get better? Or be replaced? There are way too many restaurants in Downtown Summerlin for this one to be wasting space by not being as good.

Delicious. I cannot wait to come back! My boyfriend and I both got an Aussie burgers and they were so good!!! The sweetness of the pineapple mixed with the sourness of the beetroot was just amazing. The fries are really good too. By the time you get to the bottom, they're still crispy! I definitely recommend it. (:

Ate at 1100 am today. This place has a few things to work on. 
#1. Duplicate the menu board for outside the door. If you have never been here before your going to clog the line trying to decide.
#2. Teach staff to listen to orders and repeat as they enter to POS .
#3. Teach cooks to read and expiditers to check orders before they go out. I lacked 2.00 Avacado and 1.50 bacon on my 14.00 Waygu beef burger that was over cooked. And I never got the side mayo.
#4. Unless I'm in a 5 star restaurant I should not have to pay for water. We live in a desert, whatcha gonna do in the summer when folks are standing outside in 100+° weather. If you don't have room for ice machine and glasses. Give bottles of cold water, you charge enough to make it up.
#5. Fridge should be really cold. My expensive Root beer was warm. And the girl who cleared my table of condiment bottles removed it before I was through drinking it.
#6. I know your Ribs are par cooked(steamed) before being put onto a grill. You guys should work on that for the price. However in all fairness they had great flavor. The Waygu beef should have been juicy as that is the style of beef (fat content). It was not .
#7. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands, on the way back I peered into the kitchen you are holding raw ground meat at room temp in a hotel pan on the counter with which to make pattys for burgers. You should have that pan on ice to keep the temp cool. 
2 people 60.00 bucks at lunch with no alcohol.
I'm on the fence with this place with giving it another shot once they have settled in.

Who doesn't like ribs?  Or burgers?  You can get both here!  Located in Downtown Summerlin, Ribs & Burgers is another addition to the growing number of restaurants located in the still new "downtown" area on the west side of the Las Vegas valley.

When you walk in, you can review the menu (on the wall) and then place your order at the counter to your right.  Quick and easy once you know what you want, although it seems a little awkward to stand in front of the main entrance while you take in the respectable choices for the first time.  Three of us were there for the first time and felt like we were partially blocking the door while we made our selections.

I ordered the Beef Ribs, my wife ordered the Original Burger with Bacon and Cheese, and we ordered the Beef Rib Bullets for our son.

I like beef ribs better than pork and this drove my choice for my first visit here.  The beef ribs were definitely tasty, but honestly, they were average.  They were good enough though that I want to go back and try the pork and lamb ribs.  That's right, they have lamb ribs!  Unique!  To be sure there's no confusion, I'd happily have the beef ribs again, too.  They were cooked well, tasted great, but they just weren't my favorite.

My wife was very satisfied with her burger.  Juicy and cooked just right.  We were a bit confused with the beef bullets we ordered for our son though.  We asked what they were at the counter when we ordered and the waitress told us they were just the meat tips from the ribs.  This wasn't the case.  They were the full rib (with the bone) cut into slices to make them bite-sized "bullets".  They were good, but they weren't what we were told they'd be.

While it was an order at the counter affair, you sit after you order and the staff brings you your meal.  Everyone was courteous and our waiter came back to the table several times while we enjoyed our food.

For fans of ribs and messy hands, take note, there aren't wipes at the table but there's a sink with soap and tools in the middle of the restaurant.  Cool concept, allowing you to actually wash your hands instead of just wiping them with a tiny toilette (without having to go to the bathroom), but you're literally right beside another table of customers when you're washing your hands.  It felt awkward to me, and I wouldn't have liked other people constantly walking up to my table to wash their hands.  Easy to avoid by not sitting there though.  Not a problem, but again, a little awkward if someone is sitting at the table right next to the washing station.

Note there are non-rib and burger menu options, including chicken wings, steak or grilled chicken sandwiches and chicken breasts.  They also have a small selection salads and a vegetarian burger.  Have kids?  Bring them.  There's a kid's menu.

I'll definitely go back to try the other ribs, especially the lamb ribs.  I'll keep you posted what I find!

If you have a kid with special needs, do not come here!  A gentleman was worried about his silly benches and asked a family to leave because their daughter was standing on the bench(without shoes and not being disruptive).  Seriously?!!  Do not spend your money here, and go somewhere else!!  How do places like this stay in business with such rude management?!
Ribs are amazing, and the burgers are huge!  A bit pricy, but worth it if you feel lazy and not wanting to spend all day cooking. My only complaint is their water tastes horrible.

First let me say that the staff here are great. Super friendly and attentive which is the only reason this place got the third star. The first time I ate here the burger was great. This time I brought back the family and the burgers were flavorless. This kind of inconsistency makes it hard to want to come back even though the Resturant has a great ambiance and outdoor eating and is in a great location.

My husband and I LOVE to go out and eat burgers. I have lived in Las Vegas for well over 20 years. We go to many different places to eat. This burger (which is worth the wait), is one of THE BEST BURGERS I HAVE HAD EVER!!!!  The juice just pours out of the burger. I did not even need any toppings. I had a bun, but did not even need that. I WILL BE BACK. My husband and I both LOVED LOVED LOVED it!  Please TRY IT, you will NOT be disappointed, the atmosphere, is very unique. They also have wine and beer too. VERY NICE outside seating for a nice day.

I went in with my family last weekend and I thought the place was great!  Everyone we encountered was friendly and the food was incredible. The only knock I would give is the amount of fries. We all ordered a side of fries, and we only needed half that. We will be back!

Had an early dinner here with my wife at around 5:30 on wednesday the 24th day of June 2015. It was your typical triple digit temp day in Vegas so the nice cool air that greeted us as we came in was a welcome feeling.

You order at the counter, they give you a bucket with utensils and two sauces in it. You sit down at whatever table thats open and then later on you get your food. On your bucket there is a number assigned to you so that they know who's order was theirs.

I ordered the Ribs Combo ($18). It is a combination of baby back ribs and Korean short ribs. Comes with your choice of a side and cole slaw. My wife got the Lamb Burger ($14).

The baby back ribs were just ok. Not fall off the bone like but had enough tenderness to it for me to bite it off the bone with no problems. It wasnt dry but I thought lacked a bit of flavor. I squirted some of the barbeque sauce on it along with the fry sauce that came with the bucket. The barbeque sauce had no flavor either. The fry sauce was really good. For the side you had your choice of salad or fries. I chose fries. They definitely go good with the fry sauce but I think everything goes good with it. The cole slaw tasted like it didnt have enough vinegar. I tasted mainly mayo. The other half of my combo were Korean short ribs. Man, now these were really good. Marinated and cooked just right. Portions were generous. I would go back just for these alone.

As for my wife's Lamb Burger, she did not like it after the first bite. I gave it a couple bites as well just to verify. The bun that it was on was a bit dry. The ground lamb patty had a strong after taste which I think means that the lamb is not meant to be grounded and that they did not cook it properly. As a side note, I have had lamb chops before straight off the grill when I had visited Melbourne, Australia some years ago and let me tell you those chops had no after taste whatsoever! Ever since then, anything lamb related I  compare it to that point in time. I was told that if the lamb was not prepared and cooked properly, then you will have a strong after taste.

The service could use a bit of improvement. When I got my food they bring it out to you on wooden cutting boards. I like the concept but here's what kind of turned me off as the first bad impression. When the lady brought the ribs out to my table, the short ribs that were on it were dangling a bit off the edge of the cutting board, which caused the marinated juices to drip off to the side. I kid you not, our server had a trail from the kitchen to our table. To make matters worse, after she put the cutting board down the the juices continued to drip down onto our table. I had to move the short ribs away from the edge of the cutting board just so the sticky sauce would not drip all over the table and on to my pants. Thats just bad presentation.

Some other things worth mentioning. They dont have any fountain drinks there that they can refill for you. You have to purchase soda by way of 16 oz bottles. I paid 2 bucks for a coke zero. Thank God they didnt charge for just a glass of ice water. In the middle of the restaurant there is a sink that you can wash your hands in. Not a bad idea for those messy two handed eaters.

Overall, I think that they need to work on the service and presentation a little bet better. Food was just slightly above mediocre. I would like to try them again sometime and hope that things improve a bit better.

Yelp 2015 Review #33
532 oaverall

Very unorganized. Our food came out at four different times. First, two burgers. Five minutes later, our fries showed up, then another 5 minutes after that, my frinds entree. THEN, after that, my well done fries. By that time, my burger was totally cold. They were very stingy with napkins. HELLO! YOUR A RIB AND BURGER PLACE! Didn't even have glassware. Water came in a dixie cup. (I didn't order water, but the lady at the next table,  was ill impressed) They beef bullets were nothing but bone. The burger was good, but overall, "Meh."

My daughter has special need and Dylan who ever he is told my family we have to leave due to the fact that my autistic daughter was standing on the bench seat. He said he can't have that. So anyone who wants to go I hope you don't because of the way they treated my special needs daughter. On a side note I wish he would have told me and not my wife.

Ate there last night.... Nice setting  to eat, good staff..... As for the food we first ordered the beef ribs and sent them back because they seemed to be small for beef and all bones. 
The good thing was no one had an issue with it and they whipped us up a slab of the pork ribs.... all I can saw is wow..... very meaty, good taste.. very happy we switched.

Fries and onion strings where also very tasty.....  

It's nice to have new rib joint in the area as we have very upset with the ribs at Lucille's, Outback, Famous Dave's and a few others

Wow! I can't believe I have waited over a year to try this place out. I walked by and I saw a special going on for a burger and fries. I added avocado and they did not hold out. Literally delicious chunks of the avocado fell from the burger next to the savory drippings as I took my first bite. Their protein is on another level. Their fries and special pink sauce are just the perfect pairing to a nice lunch. With an ice tea by the window and excellent service...call it a day!

I'm always open to give places second chances but not so much for this place. When my friend and I first walked in we were confused trying to find the menu. After searching around, we found that the menu was across the cashier on a chalkboard; very inconvenient when ordering. My friend ordered a "bacon cheeseburger" and I ordered the "old skool burger," both of which were huge disappointments. Our burgers were both well done even though they claim that their burgers are "medium."
The only thing notable was the onion strings I got, but $18 for a burger and onion strings, it's overpriced. To top it off, we waited around half an hour and the waitress never gave me my water.

Aside from my terrible food, the staff is very lackluster. One worker was just outside the restaurant on a phone call talking to a friend while the rest of the workers seemed clueless when trying to deliver the food. My waitress literally walked around the restaurant twice trying to find my number. Furthermore, the waiters/waitress don't even check on you if you needed anything or if your food was good. Very unprofessional.

I now know why they make you pay before getting your food, otherwise everyone would just leave.

Pros:
The weather was good

Cons:
Confused staff
inexperienced staff
lackluster burgers
overpriced
long ordering time

I can't see this place open for another three months.

I had the salmon on a plank it was great.  We shared the antipasto salad and it was my favorite thing we had.  My husband had the ribs and they were falling off the bones.  The fries came with fry sauce which is always a hit in my book.  Whimsical place.  Order at the counter, fast friendly service.  We would repeat it!

I love this place. I read the reviews while sitting here waiting for my food. The complaints were ridiculous. Before writing all these bad reviews you should really think about what really matters at the end of the day it's the food and the service and I thought both were great! It's a different kind of place... This is exactly why I came here I don't want to go to a restaurant that looks like every other restaurant and feels like every other place. Go check this place out I absolutely love the lamb ribs and the banana shake!!!
