I love the food here!  It is a quick meal and the surrounding stores are what you'd expect at a large mall.  We have been eating here for about a year and a half, and I try buying something besides the lamb ribs, but I can't do it.  The sauce and tasty ribs beckon me.  The fries are also amazing!  My husband loves the lamb burger.  They have patio dining and TVs...great restaurant!

Located in Downtown Summerlin, you can find Ribs and Burgers right next to Wetzel's Pretzels. After having watched a movie we were just walking around and doing some window shopping (and actual shopping), when we decided to grab a quick bite to eat and try this place out.

We each opted for an original burger ($8.50). I decided to enjoy mine with a slice of American cheese ($1 extra) while my friend added Swiss cheese on his. This is just for the burger. Fries or any other sides will cost you extra. Bottomless fountain drinks were available serving Coke products ($2.90 each). Beer was available there as well.

The burgers were fat and juicy and tasted pretty good! These were very sloppy, messy burgers. Not a bad thing, just an observation. Not the best burger I've had in the city, but still alright. 

Service was good, so there was definitely no issue there. The guys who rang us up and refilled our drinks were very cordial and friendly. 

At this price point, I have to say that everything was alright, but I wasn't blown away by anything. You could do a lot worse though.

3 stars.

A-Ok.

Where do I began with this place? My husband and I wanted to try a new place and we were looking for ribs. We noticed this place listed on the Downtown Summerlin website and decided to give it a try. We don't typically go on yelp prior to visits so we can have an open mind. So here's our take on this place...


First off, the ordering process and area is uncomfortable and a bit off point from your typical restaurant. The large menu facing the cashiers is weird and causes traffic. You place your order and they hand you a bucket with your number and some utensils. The concept is the server needs to bring the food to you, wherever you decide to sit is up to you. Issue with this is as we got a table, we overheard servers stating "I can't find where #8 is sitting" they walked around a few times till they found them. It's not easy for them to get your food to you because they are on a scavenger hunt. 

Second, when it comes to the basic service they are lacking quite a bit. The bucket provided doesn't provide enough napkins, they don't check on you until your done with your meal and getting a second beverage is a nightmare. You have to flag someone down to get water. And even then they are so overwhelmed in turning tables or searching for table numbers, that they will forget about your request.  

Lastly, the food itself is served on a wooden board. We get the whole different rustic serving dish idea, however, it does not work well at all with a rack of ribs and fries. They plated the fries underneath and if you are trying to cut your ribs fries fall off the board and on to the table. A completely uncomfortable mess when your hands are full of bbq sauce. As far as the taste is concerned the Lamb ribs were perfectly cooked, great slaw. Side note on bbq sauce: it would be nice to have wet napkins available. 

I will leave you with this: if you got plenty of time to wait in line, wanting as little attention as possible and don't mind eating off a board you should check this place out.

Ok, Truth is more like a 3.5 stars.
When we first walked in, it felt a bit chaotic. Which is odd, since there was a guy there trying to instruct everybody on how it all work, to make it easier. But in a way I can't quite explain, he somehow made it more confusing.

But, hey, we are smart guys. We figured it out pretty quickly. Look at the board, order from the cute smiling person behind the register, sit down.

I ordered a 1/2 rack baby back...(yes you should say it 6X really fast!) and a side of sweet potato tater tots. Both were great. Ordered a side of aioli for the tots, and it was a home run. The sauce on the ribs was a bit on the sweet side for me. So adding sweet potato tots gave me a double sweet thing going on. Maybe next time onion strings? The ribs were super tender, and the meat really tasty!

My partner ordered a naked turkey burger, side of fries and cabbage salad.
The burger looked more like a burger on a clump of iceberg. I think he was envisioning a lettuce wrap burger, but once he 'wrapped' his brain around burger salad, we were good. He said he kept getting "super salty" bites with the cabbage salad. I think I liked mine more than he liked his. 

Over all, food was all pretty good. What really stood out was the service!
Once we got in to the register, every single person was AWESOME, helpful, smiling. We really felt welcomed and taken care of by the staff! With service like that, if they can iron out a few food kinks, they will be rocking that little corner in Downtown Summerlin!

Hopefully this place closes soon. I ordered the signature Lamb Ribs, maybe I was expecting something different. They were only ok tasting. If you don't really like lamb I would say DO NOT order, they were much fattier than I expected. 

And this must be a Summerlin thing of ordering off a board near the door thank god no one was before or after me cause it took me almost 5 mins to make up mind. I much rather like ordering from the table.

Where's the love? 

The reviews for Ribs and Burgers have not been kind. Most of them seem like growing pain issues, food service, menu placement, and timing. My experience here had none of these issues. Move over Dundee, this could be the next Cinderella story from down under. 

I came here for lunch with some work friends and based on the reviews, I was very intrigued to see how everything would pan out. We ordered off the wall hanging menu opposite of the counter, which seems to be an issue with some people, but they now offer paper menus, which you can grab and read while you wait inline. 

I ordered the sliders and a boozy milkshake. The sliders meal comes with two sliders, one all beef patty and one mini chicken breast. Which is a normal chicken breast, but cut in half. This meal comes with fries and is served on a cutting board. This board does leave little room to maneuver, I recommend asking for another plate for dipping sauces or for whatever you might need. 

The burger was delicious and cooked perfect. Very juicy with just a touch of pink in the middle. The sauce on top was simply called, "Pink Sauce", it's like a spicy aioli. An insanely good addition to the burger and added just a little kick. They have bottles of this stuff at the service area; I recommend dipping your fries in this stuff as well. Nummers!

The Chicken slider was super tender and super juicy. The veggies piled on top were crisp and added great texture and sweetness to the slider. It was good, but I preferred the burger to the chicken. 

The boozy milkshake was a Maple Bacon masterpiece. I'm not a sweet fan, but this thing was delicious. Great mix of sweet, salty and just a hint of vodka, which I preferred to an overly alcoholic sweet drink. I would recommend trying this at least once while you're here. They do offer flavors of boozy milkshakes incase you're not a maple fan. 

Overall, I had a great experience from the service, to the food, and vibe of the restaurant. I didn't use the sink in the middle of the restaurant; I preferred the bathroom to a public cleaning. I would most likely come back here, if I lived on this side of town. 

Hopefully Ribs and Burgers will find their glass slipper and go on to serve the hungry masses of Las Vegas.

Luv this place.. DELICIOUS!!!!!!!! Never tried lamb before. Thought I would try it. & OMG.. It was sooo bomb!!! Luved it never had anything g like it. Luv also the fact that the chef himself personally comes out socializes with customers & asks how the food is if they need anything. def comin back next time my husband & I visit VIVA.

Yelpers, where is the love? I am wondering if I went to the same restaurant with all the 1 and 2 star reviews. This place was on point for me! I ate, well, ribs and burgers, and both hit the spot! 
My boyfriend and I went here on a Saturday afternoon. The place was not packed, yet not dead either. From Yelp stalking, I knew about the sink. Towards the end of my meal, my boyfriend was looking for wetnaps, when I pointed out the hand washing station in the middle of the dining room. His reaction was priceless. 
The menu was not huge, and covered all areas of burgers and ribs. 
Between us, we ordered a full rack of baby backs, an old school burger, and a grilled chicken sandwich. I also opted for a side salad versus fries for the side with my ribs.  
I will start by saying the ribs are ideal for my preference.  Some people like a dry rub, some like smokey. Some prefer the grill, while others prefer a slow cooker, fall off the bone style. For me, I like meaty, full of flavor, and not too tough. Well there is your description of the ribs, everything I like and more. There was a small amount of char, but the meat was still juicy and succulent. They have pink sauce, which I had no idea but apparently is a thing with ribs. (Tasted like fry sauce) My boyfriend loved them because he was reminded of how his mom used to cook his food. I did not try his grilled chicken sandwich, but he devoured it, so that speaks for itself. My old school burger was great. I LOVE when you can taste meat quality. It is a big deal to me, especially when I pay anything over $10 for a burger. ($9.50 for this one)
The side salad was even good. With that being said, it was the only thing we didn't finish. Good, but not comparable to the meat! 
I hope Ribs & Burgers heads to Henderson soon. But for now, I have an excuse to visit Downtown Summerlin.

Had lunch there just a few days ago, for the first time. Had a great experienced!!! We order the Waygu burger which was prepared to perfection and temperature. Came out nice, warm and juicy. The pork ribs were AWESOME, so moist and delicious!! Collin who cooked our meal was a treat to meet. Atmosphere was clean, cool and casual. Happy and satisfy customer, will go back soon. sorry no pic, next time!
Atmosphere and location is good. The menu appears to be great but the food is basic. Not too much diversity in flavor, sorry.

I was very excited to try this place. However we went on a Monday night and they were out of the beef ribs, and the kids ribs. My son was really wanting ribs that is why we chose a rib place to eat that night. We asked if the could make the pork ribs into a kids size and they said no. So we walked out. We went back on a Thursday afternoon to try again. They had ribs this time but we had other issues. My husband and I wanted diet cokes. All they serve are bottled soda. They only had 1 diet coke left!! And they had the mini 8 Oz coke zero. So my husband had to get 2 and you know they charged $7 for them meanwhile the 20 Oz they were out of only cost $3.50!! They did nothing to compensate.  Then we asked for a wet towelettes that you would get a rib place and they told us that don't have them that we needed to use the sink. The food was not that great either. Because of these experiences we will not be back.
My first impression as soon as we walked in was not to welcoming.  But after the rough part, we were able to enjoy a delicious salmon burger & some fries.

This place isn't only known for their ribs n burgers but their shakes and adult shakes. Their shakes are the best! I'll be back to try their burgers and ribs! The place is clean and the staff is friendly! And they also have adult shakes there too! Oreo with chocolate vodka is my favorite. 

Had their sliders (1) chicken (1) burger and some fries. It was really tasty. Wasn't overly salty and the meat was just right =] 10/10 I'll be here again.

Love the ambience and food, I'm not a lamb person by any means I cringe at the thought of testing lamb. But the lamb ribs here are amazing, I love how tender and juicy they are I can't get over it.. Plus the wagyu burger is delicious.

I posted a prior review regarding our visit on 07/15/16...we decided to give this place another shot on Friday, August 12, 2016.  So glad we did.  The service was great this time around, and all our food came out at the same time (a problem on the first visit)  My husband and I both ordered the half slab, his sauced and mine not, with fries.  Absolutely delicious.  The staff was relaxed and friendly, and they kept the Coca Cola refills coming.  We're already looking forward to our next visit!
The food was good... The ambience great...the founder Jeffrey amazing. I would return just because his conversation was so great. If your in the Summerlin area you should definitely stop by.

Being from New Zealand we have beetroot in our burgers so excited to see the Aussie burger with beetroot (those from NZ, Aust, UK or South Africa it's not the tangy beetroot we are used to) anyway they forgot the beetroot in both our burgers, when I went to complain they looked at me blankly when I said it was missing the beetroot.  Asked server about sauce on ribs and he said he didn't know if ribs were sauced or not?  Fries were ok, crunchy but bland, a nice seasoned salt would be nice.

Love this place! Had the 2 sliders and the half rack of ribs, the sliders were awesome and the ribs were great too! Only reason for not giving it 5 stars is bc the service is a lil weird we had to get up and ask for refills but they do bring the food to the table...
The staff was amazing the food was to die for and the price was perfect I do eat here every day if I could great atmosphere I give it six stars if it would let me

I'm still shaking my head at the prices of this food. Burgers not served with fries, but the price of fries is exorbitant. Waited 55 minutes for food. This is the second time we've tried it will not return

My burger was just so bad. I wanted to like this place. Great concept, cool vibe, but the burger was awful. Tasted and looked like a frozen patty. My burger was cooked well done which is a burger SIN in my book. Fries were good and the cabbage salad was good too. With so many good burger options in Vegas I wouldn't waste your time here.

Convenient, semi-fast and good food. Typical type of place to eat at when out shopping.

We will be back!

I was very disappointed. You order a 13 dollar burger like you're in a subway. No servers. You take a number and grab a seat. I ordered the Aussie burger which comes with an egg on it. I asked for medium rare because I'm from the south, so well-done meat is pointless murder in my opinion. I asked how long it would take because we were catching a movie next door and my recent, poor experience at Trattoria Regiano left me hungry and dissatisfied. She said, "ten minutes or less is our thing".  "Perfect", I replied. 16 minutes later starving. I look at the food window and I see my burger sitting there. Food runners were out back smoking or something. So I broke the rules, got up and grabbed it myself. The cooks looked at me and said, "oh sorry bro the runners should bring it to you". Obviously their gimmick is to serve their burgers ridiculously tall so you can't fit your mouth around it. It was absurd. Like 8 inches tall. I HATE eating burgers with a fork. The meat was well-done and the egg was hard rubber. I picked at it for a second but was irate. Left it sitting and peace'd out. The employees couldn't care a less, I'm sure. Holler back.

My husband and I ate here yesterday. I got the Old School Cheese with a side of onion strings and he got a full rack of baby back ribs with fries. We weren't greeted for a while when we entered the restaurant and though it said to order at the counter, we were unsure if we could be seated and have our order taken there as well. We were greeted after approaching the counter to order. We sat down and again, I was unsure if there would be table service when my drink ran out and waited a bit to see if somebody would come by or if I needed to take my glass to the counter for a refill. There was only one other family eating so it wasn't as if they were swamped and couldn't get to us. The food was great. I love the "pink sauce" as they call it. My family is from Idaho so I grew up on fry sauce and you don't typically find it at restaurants out here. I loved the food and only docked a star for the minor lack of service.

We tried the Original burger and the Lamb burger. Both were very good. The lamb especially had great flavor and the bacon added to the original was the best. Overall it was a nice quick dinner and we will be back.

Disappointed this time,  I had company from out of town an I had talked up the place on the quality of the ribs.  They wanted to stay home so we ordered pick-up.  This is about the 6th time I've ordered pick up from them.  It was about 6:30pm on a Saturday the place was very slow about 6 people in the restaurant.  The older gentleman who I believe is the Manager rarely acknowledges you with eye contact let alone a smile. But the cashier was very nice. My order was waiting when I arrived.  I noticed the French fries were placed in a Baggie out side. (Cold) normally every time they are in the same box as the ribs an remain nice an warm.  The ribs were dry, not plump an juicy.  My company said we can get the same thing at Smiths.  
It seems as Management is going down hill an is reflected in the quality.  There was a point that you felt very welcomed by the Chubby mgr who was very personable an would welcome you there an wish you a heartfelt thank you.  But now seems your at a QSR at the mall.

Sent from my iPhone

A few weeks ago, I went there on a Saturday morning excited to try a new burger joint.  When I arrived, the first thing the order taker told me is that they are out of ribs! I. Was surprised how they can be out of ribs. I ordered the burger.  The burger was small and it lacked any special kick.  I'll be honest with you but Carls Jr. has Better burgers.
I get home and try to register the rewards program on the computer and it's the most complicated sign up process that I've encountered In long time.

The service was ok and the decor of this place was nice but I don't intend on returning.

Ate here yesterday...the old skool buger was superb. We also ordered half rack beef ribs...the sauce was good but there was hardly any meat on the bones plus it was kinda burnt...my husband & I never complain  about anything especially  at a restaurant....to say the least, we will give it another try, but order baby back  instead...one thing that stood out is that they have a sink to wash your hands in the common dining area in which I thought was a great idea...how convenient. I'm looking forward to patronizing  this eatery real soon.
Best BBQ chicken wings I've ever had. Burger was just as amazing. This was my second time and it was even better than I remembered. Not sure how they could get bad reviews

Been meaning to write a review. My favorite place in Summerlin or the westside for burgers.
Love the patio on a nice day, fairly entertaining people watching. Agree with others its a bit pricey for the suburbs but compare it to some of the way overpriced burger restaurants on the strip and its a value.

I am addicted to the onion strings, some of the best I have ever had.

I am keen to the original burger with Swiss, just a traditional burger but its always cooked just right. The portions are also filling not to much not to little.

The staff is always friendly and welcoming.

Go here

I heard good things about the restaurant so we decided to try it. Boy were we disappointed. The prices were too high for what you get. the food was over priced. No service. The wait is way too much. It takes forever to order or eat. 
The worst of it all is the idea of trying to find a place to sit.

I would rather go to Red Robin.

Meh...not impressed.  Definitely overpriced for what you get.  Nothing special about the burgers or the 'famous' fries.  Wish I would have checked Yelp before!  Awkward ordering setup when you enter and no fountain drinks?! Super confusing.  Wasn't too crowded and took a long time for food to come out.  There was a lot of staff walking around but not one stopped to ask how our food was or if we needed anything.  Major fail.

I was really hoping this place improved after all their bad early reviews. I'm a fan of burger and a fan of ribs. And, with this place being close to home I was praying there would be a decent rib place to me. Unfortunately, this place has some issues. The Vegas pork bullets ($16) are basically three ribs that are cut cross-section/perpendicular to the bone. The meat was tender, but incredibly oily with no hint of smoke. The chicken breasts ($14) are two small breasts pounded thin and overcooked as to render them almost inedible. At least the fries were good.
Food is awesome here! I went in for a the Australian burger, had some sweet potato fries and it was delicious. Cute style and decoration. Friendly staff.

First time here. Cute decor. Had the lamb burger & sweet potato tots. Both were delicious but what prompted me to write a quick review was their customer service. I spilled my glass of water immediately after seating down. Young lady was over & cleaning it up before I could gather my purse to go ask someone for assistance. She even asked if I wanted to switch booth but of course it wasn't necessary. Male employee came by twice to ask how was my food & topped off my water (without asking) when he noticed it was low. Thank a bunch & keep up he good work. I'll be back!

I went here for my birthday & I'm so glad I did! It's a more casual place, but the food was delicious & the servers/cashiers/manager were AWESOME!!!!

I'm from Australia, so it's great to see Aussie restaurants making its way to America!
 
I'm definitely coming back.

We were hungry and decided to eat at sweet tomatoes. It was my 7yo daughters choice. My wife past the exit on accident and I suggested going to down town summerlin and pick a random place -figured it would be more interesting. 

So we ended up at a  ribs and burgers place, not quite salad but here we are. 

So as much as I would love to try their ribs, I was in a burger mood, I ordered the original, add bacon, add Swiss cheese (only have American and Swiss on the menu and I am not a fan of American cheese). My wife ordered the original with American cheese, 7yo daughter got the turkey burger, and my 3 yo daughter got the kids meal slider. We ordered a side of fries (large) and a cabbage salad (had apples, pine nuts, and vinegarette dressing) to share. 

This places has a different burger style than other great burger places, but still very good. I like different.
They are kinda sweet, but they did come with bbq sauce (not a ton),so maybe the sweetness is from the sauce. The burgers were very tasty, cooked perfectly, I really enjoyed my burger!

The fries were pretty good, not seasoned but good. However a large was to much for us. The cabbage salad was sweet as well, but I guess that is expected with the apples, it was decent but not my favorite... Kinda tasted like cranberries would had fit really well on the salad (pretty sure not an option). 

My daughters and wife all enjoyed their meals. 

OH YEAH, great service. The staff here is an amazing group who cares about your food and experience in their restaurant. 

We will eat there again!

Short version: 
Good food for the money and fantastic service.  Manager Brandon really made sure it was a great experience.  I also appreciate and support that they employ people with visible tattoos.

I was pleasantly surprised on my first visit to Ribs and Burgers.  It's a casual place with an outdoor patio, but the menu was definitely full of potential.  My first choice was the salmon, but they were out (it was late evening).   I chose the kid menu ribs and my dining partner chose the chicken protein plate.    They also have military/veteran discount, which is always cool.

The kid menu ribs came with four hearty ribs and fries.  I don't generally eat fries, but I had a small nibble and they were delicious. The pork ribs were super tender, had just a bit of sauce, and were not gristly or fatty at all.   I would come back for the ribs for sure.

The chicken plate came with two seasoned chicken breasts and a cabbage/apple salad.  I am not a huge chicken fan, but that chicken was incredibly good.  Moist and seasoned perfectly.  The salad was fresh and crisp.  

They serve boozy milkshakes which sounded interesting.  I didn't get to try those on this trip.

Brandon, the manager, was super informative about the food.  I really appreciated him taking the time to talk to me about the food origin and preparation. 

I look forward to future visits to give the salmon and some of the other menu items a try.
Loved the modern vibe as well as great old school burger, excellent selection of tap beers, first class service. I'll be back, this restaurant is close to the move theater in  Downtown Summerlin.

If your in the mood for a great burger this is the place! I'm super picky and have to have it well done. It was cooked perfect and still juicy inside. (my husband loves the ribs), great staff and service... Gotta try the shakes next time.

I read the other reviews and they now must have fountain soda since I didn't have to buy the bottle of coke.  My husbands ice tea was fresh and refilled before it got empty.  We ordered the combo baby back ribs and burgers and shared.  We also got the fries and slaw.  The burgers were ordered med cooked and came out perfectly.  The ribs were very good, I liked them as they were without the sauce.  I tried the sauce, wasn't too crazy about it, however my husband loved the fry sauce.  The slaw was okay, not so crazy about the mint in it I prefer the more traditional sweet and vinegar dressing.  We thought the service was excellent, the wonderful aroma brought us in from the street.  We sat outside and it was great, soft music quiet. Really enjoyed it and will go back again.  I want to try the salmon with a glass of wine next time, I know my husband will go for the ribs again.

This place is amazing! I've been wanting to try it out since it opened and finally got the chance. The ribs fall off of the bone so tender and taste amazing! It is a counter order place, and they deliver your food to you. I loved it, the music was great, the seating was comfortable, and the atmosphere is just perfect. They even have a sink for you to clean up at in the middle of the restaurant! My fiancé had the grilled chick, and it was fantastic too. Do yourself a favor next time your in Downtown Summerlin and give them a try you won't be sorry.

My new favorite! You know a place is good when you're writing the review in your head while you're still eating. First off, this is an Australian/South African ribs and burgers place so don't expect American style when you get here. The ribs a moist and full of unique flavor - almost like a steak you can eat with your fingers. The arugula salad is fresh and excellent. Burgers are reminiscent of your favorite family reunion and the fries are seriously addictive. Staff is on it and the vibe is upbeat. If I'd have one complaint, it's that the chicken has too much char for my taste and too much chat in general for the kiddo, but otherwise, we'll be back as soon as possible!

Great burger and tap beer! The Aussie burger was the bomb. Can't go wrong with bacon, cheese, egg, and a pineapple slice atop a juicy burger! The regular sized fries is more the size for 2 people. More than enough. Love the ambiance too.

the ONLY reason i'm giving this a 2 star rating was the service.  the food was good, good size burger, a little on the pricey side, but this is summerlin, so no real surprise there.  
but the staff member, sandra ( i think that's her name, she mumbled it so i'm only guessing here) was horrible.  she was the shorter one of the two and was working the cash register. i'm sorry, i don't often say that but i just couldn't let this one go.  not only did she act totally disinterested in working there, but i couldn't understand her very well, and when i asked her to clarify something on the menu, she acted like it was a complete bother.  i guess the other server, who was actually very nice, noticed because she stepped in and answered my question, nice and simple. 
having never been here before it would have been nice to be actually spoken to and not grunted at.  and when i asked about the process for ordering, because it is a little different, she basically shrugged all the answers and was completely unhelpful.
sorry ribs/burgers, i want to like you, i really do, but because of this experience with a put out staff member, i won't be back any time soon.

*** A friend was invited by the PR people to try the R&B offerings.  We were not charged. ***

When we arrived, the ordering area was backed up a little.  There;s a choke point at the register when they're busy.  This will be interesting when it's in the 100s outside and people are waiting out the entrance.  There's a large menu on the left.  Some reviews have noted this and how awkward it is.  There are now paper menus available at the counter before you reach the terminals.

We met Mona who expedited our ordering and then sat with us at the table we chose on the patio.  After the order is taken, you get a metal pail with a number on it that lets the runner know where to deliver food.  The pail has two sauces, salt and pepper, some utensils, and some napkins--one for each person.

We ordered a lamb slab, an original burger with cheese, pork bullets with fries and coleslaw, onion strings, and three kid friendly milk shakes--maple bacon doughnut, birthday cake, and pecan banana split.

While waiting for our food, Mona explained the concept of R&B and one could sense her excitement and pleasure at bringing this Australian concept to the US, specifically in Downtown Summerlin where it was halfway between the fast food places at the south side of the mall and the high end places to the north.

My favorite of the meal was the lamb slab.  Good tasting meat with some good flavor from the marinade.  Since I didn't do the ordering, I'm not sure if burgers can be gotten at different temperatures.  Our burger was done well.  I would have had blood running down my chin.  The burger was OK but I didn't get the special nature of the flavors as described by Mona the way R&B constructed their burgers.  It was a burger.The menu notes their "Famous R&B fries."  There was nothing that would make these fries famous.  The fact that most of them went back when our dishes were cleared was testimony to how we both felt.

The 3 kid friendly shakes were hit and miss--mostly miss.  The birthday cake sprinkles clogged the straw so sipping it was almost impossible.  The maple bacon doughnut was just lacking in flavor but the banana split was a really good shake.

As for service, there were a number of servers always circling about but when we asked for more napkins, we did not get them.  A trip inside to the sink to wash up was necessary.  

We did ask for some ice water and we were brought glasses with ice water.  I did see some others with paper cups so I'm not sure if we were treated differently.

There are some kinks that need to be worked out.  The whole ordering process seemed overly long.  It did seem like they were turning over tables rapidly.  We'll see what the future brings.

Ribs and Burgers caught my eye when my family and I were shopping. We are a heavy meat eating family you see and you can't go wrong with a restaurant that offers two different meat options. We ordered the kids slider with fries for my daughter, knowing she doesn't eat much to begin with. My boyfriend and I also ordered  "The old school cheeseburger" and "The original." We were so captivated by taste and flavor that we barely looked up to speak to one another! My daughter finished her slider, fries, and birthday cake milk shake without a fuss (normally a very distinct eater). The GM Brandon came over and gave us the garlic aioli sauce to dip our fries and I couldn't have enough!! He even packed us some to go seeing that we ate most of our first portion. Oh and I forgot to mention that there is beer and wine (mommy and daddy juice ) that is a must sometimes after a long day and night of shopping. Overall, we will be back and recommending to others Ribs and Burgers for a stop to eat for good meat, nice service, and great conversations with the GM. Brandon and the staff makes you really feel like it's a family bbq.

Wow. Reading through the one star reviews is really making me laugh. This made up story about a special needs daughter who was dancing on the booth and singing. One word: l-i-a-b-i-l-i-t-y. If that story is actually not just made up. All of these one star reviews are definitely motivated by a competitor. Really sad.

The food here is excellent. The staff are very friendly. Definitely recommendable, especially seeing how good the food is for how much it costs. Ignore the people paid to give this place 1 star, and see for yourself how great this place is.

Do not waste your money!!!!!!!

This place is a disgrace. Extreme sexism isn't the half of it. I'm outside eating my food. This old man comes out. Dripping with blood & asks my family & I to move because "it's a restaurant" what does that mean? Why did my whole family have to move? Why are you serving food while bleeding? That's unsafe. He was extremely rude & said "my boss would kill me." I didn't even like their food here. 

Beware of this place. I did not expect to be spoken to like that. I expected to have a good day until this.  

The food wasn't even that good. Too expensive & not worth it.

We decided to try something new for casual family dinner. We were not disappointed. On the contrary, we were pleasantly surprised! My only complaint was price. I'm a little torn by the value. 

The decor is cute and rustic. There's a sink in the middle of the dining room which is different and fun....or may make you feel like a circus animal.  

I had a cheeseburger with crispy onions substituted for the raw. It had BBQ sauce, pickles and was cooked perfectly!  It was flavorful and juicy. A truly scrumptious burger. That said, it was $10 and didn't come with anything. Just a burger. My little guy had ribs and fries for $8 with a side of ranch for an extra $1.30. Seriously? That's a little much. Hubby had lamb ribs with cabbage salad. The kids ribs meal was generous and soooo tender. They fell apart and were yummy. Hubby raved about his! The salad was flavorful, light and fresh. So, 1 burger, 1 rib meal and 1 kids meal and 3 ice waters...$40. I think it's a bit steep for counter service. The prices would make more sense if they had waiter service. 

Everyone was very pleasant, welcoming and helpful. The food was delicious. 

Bottom line. Good food. Cute place. Nice people. I would return!

Even after reading all of the negative reviews we stopped in to get our own opinion. I am so glad I didn't let other people's negative comments stop me from coming! 
For only being in business 31 days (as of 4-18-15) they were very organized. Especially since it's dinner rush time on a Saturday night. The entire staff was friendly, professional and accommodating. NO COMPLAINTS!!!!!
There are two entrances into this place. One off the promenade that walks you through the patio seating and one from the street. The registers you order at are closer to the street entrance. The owner was working tonight and pleasantly greeted us and explained a few things about the menu since it was our first time in. NONE of their food is smoked! It's all cooked on an open flame.  
The GM was there too. Cleaning tables, running food and checking on the guest's experience. 
We split the Wagyu burger with cheese and added bacon. All of their burgers come cooked medium unless requested differently. We also split the pork bullet combo with a chicken slider & beef slider and fries. 
Everything was delicious! Burger was a perfect medium, juicy and full of flavor. I wish I had a bigger mouth to take a full bite. That sucker was tall. 
The pork bullets are basically rib tips but meatier. They were cooked to perfection. Not tough at all and had a unique flavor to them. I didn't need extra BBQ sauce because they came with enough. 
The chicken slider was great. Had a little spice bite to it.
Probably should have gotten 2 chicken sliders since we already had a burger but we wanted to try that too. 
The fries were great and even though the pink sauce wasn't meant for dipping fries, it works. 
It's ribs and a juicy burger so it's going to end up all over your hands right? No weak wet naps here! After you've licked off as much as you can you can wash them at the fully functional sink in the middle of the restaurant. Want more drinking water but don't want to go back up to the register? The drinking water spout is right next to the sink!

We ordered the pocket burger lunch combo!  The burger was charbroiled and tasted awesome!  Fresh bun, great fries, and a drink. $10. Great atmosphere, friendly staff, great food!  Will definitely be back for more.
Omg the ribs are so awesome.  Well everything I tasted was delicious.  The owner was very welcoming. He explained the menu to us.  Fast friendly service. One of my new favorite places.

Very disappointed, only positive was the restaurant has a nice patio for dinning. Food was not good. The burgers were over cooked. Ordered them medium and they came out well done. Also ordered a half rack of ribs and they were very dry. Very limited menu, not many options. For limited options you would figure they could produce decent food. Will not give this place second chance.

We only popped in for a beer, which happened to be on day one of their operation and coincidentally St. Pattys Day.  Come to find out that Las Vegas is lucky to have the first Ribs and Burgers (from Australia) in the country.  

Busy during afternoon and figuring out things in the chaos of day one opening, but staff was friendly, music was cool, open feel to dining room, lots of light, outdoor seating, had cool beer offerings.  

Although I did not eat and I don't give 5 Stars often, I give them 5 because everything is there for an outstanding experience.  I will come back to eat and you should too.

I WANTED TO LIKE THIS PLACE, WANTED!
But unfortunately, all the other negative reviews about this place were correct.

SUMMARY: 
Food was not worth the price.
Unorganized
Rude staff
Awkward layout

My BF and I was here for their grand opening but didn't bother going in because it was too crowded, but we returned to try it yesterday 3/29/15. Yes, it's a new restaurant and things are messy at first BUT I've never seen such a disorganized and rude restaurant like this.
There is no line formation and the menu is hard to see. I had to squeeze my way pass the line to grab the paper menu at the front (I felt rude doing that because I looked like I was cutting in line).
MENU:
The price of ribs were reasonable but the burgers and everything else were overpriced for the quality.

After we ordered, we were handed our bucket and cups for our water. The water was located in the middle of the restaurant, which was a bit awkward because it was next to the sink along with condiments. If this place was busy this area would be too crowded. I was able to fill up one cup and half to wait about 10 minutes to fill up my other cup, I was disappointed cause it was a very hot day and the water was warm. 
STAFF:
We waited about 20 minutes for our food, not bad, but during the wait we noticed that the servers kept delivering orders to incorrect tables. We slowly got turned off by this restaurant's ambiance as the "manager" (tall man in casual attire) would yell at his employees in front of customers on the floor.
My BF asked one of the servers if they had hot sauce and she snapped "You have to get it yourself!You didn't see it next the water?" Please train your servers and managers in customer service!!

FOOD:
Lamb Ribs $18: meh. My BF makes if better from the Costco ribs. I was only able to eat the meat(should I say FAT) on top because everything else was just tough and flavorless. LITERALLY FLAVORLESS, NOT EVEN A CHARCOAL OR LAMB FLAVOR. I buried it under the BBQ sauce so there was some flavor. They give you an opinion of side salad or fries, I chose salad. Salad was overdressed with oil, actually it was just SWIMMING in oil. Yeah, just oil...

Naked Mediterranean Burger $14: they should make it cheaper for no bun. They should also just name it regular hamburger because you could probably go to your fave fast food chain and get a better burger. It was overlooked/burnt with no flavor (maybe it had flavor but it was burnt away). It came out on a WILTED, OLD lettuce (see pic) had to send it back. The manager (short guy in causal attire) took it, said nothing and threw it back onto our table. NO APOLOGY!!! 

END: 1 star for now, might come back in a couple months to allow them to straighten out all their problems, IF they even survive.
We tried half rack lamb with fries and Aussie burger with sweet potato tarts. They were absolutely delicious! But next time I will get the full rack instead of half a rack.

Decided to go and get ribs. Loved them! Service wonderful,  the only thing that I don't like about the place is the fast food feel. It reminds me of the Patio in Chicago Suburbs, but better food. I recommend that if you want ribs and quick that you come here...

This place deserves 5 stars and nothing less! I deleted my Yelp a long time ago but needed to make a new one to give these guys 5 stars. This was hands down the best veggie burger I've EVER had (and I've had a lot..) It was a portabella mushroom cap instead of a hamburger patty, with avocado, fried onion strings, and a garlic aoli... it was to die for! The fries were also incredible and there were many sauces for us to dip them in.. one being a thousand island style sauce, a chili sauce, and a chili-ranch sauce.. all house made and absolutely delicious. The people that work here are also super nice. My boyfriend and I changed our mind last minute that we wanted regular fries instead of sweet potato tots, and the chef saw me standing in line and he pulled me out of line and asked how he could help! Also, the server (or maybe he's the manager.. not sure but he's Hawaiian) came over to our table multiple times asking if he could get us anything and brought us out chili sauce. Thank you Ribs & Burgers for giving us such a great dinner.. we will be back for sure!!

While waiting for my daughter to get off work next door, I stopped in to get some fries.  I was pleasantly surprised to see a portobello burger on the menu here, so I went ahead and ordered it.  It's hands down the best portobello burger I've ever eaten.   It's actually seasoned with some sort of base that is delicious.  The staff has been excellent- they even let me sample the fries before I got some.  Will definitely be back.

Ok, trying to be real here considering they have only been open about a month or so.  For the prices they charge, the food better be damn good, and it is really average.  Went on Sunday, 5/17/15, not overly crowded, plenty of seating, but took at least 20-30 minutes before our food came and it came in spurts.  Ordered Vegas Rib special, came with fries, ordered side of  house salad, and side of cole slaw,  and turkey burger.  First came the fries, then the cole slaw, then the ribs, then the turkey burger, and last came the salad.  Turkey burger was ok, it was actually a turkey breast, not ground turkey, liked the added items, like crispy onions and aioli sauce.  Ribs consisted of kalbi and baby back.  Kalbi was good, baby back not so; kind of dry and did not come off the bone. Fries were extra salty (yuck), cole slaw liquidy and bland, and the salad had some kind of vinegary dressing slathered all over it instead of on the side (no one asked how we wanted the dressing whereas most restaurants do). 

All in all, just another example of  a business wanting you to think they are upscale and trendy.  Sorry, making me order like I'm in McDonalds, then waiting for someone to bring me food, is not my idea of upscale, especially if the food is not that great. And if you take leftover food home, do not ask for a small box because it is only cardboard, has no wax covering on the bottom to hold grease and spills.  Our leftover cole slaw just oozed thru the box and by the time we got home, was all over our plastic cooler bottom.  Gross...

The food may be good but I may never know.  35 minutes to get a burger and here I still sit.

42 minutes later we got our food.  

Buns were cold as if they were just taken out of the fridge.  Onion straws on the turkey burger were cold.  The slider burger was cooked well done, not my favorite but had nice flavor.  The chicken slider was very tasty.  The ribs were flavorless.  The meat was cooked nicely and was juicy, perhaps the burnt charred outer crust that was inedible is where all the flavor would have been?

The lady running food looked sad and exasperated every time she dropped food off at a table.  I assume she was tired of having to apologize for extremely long wait times for food that should not take this long. 

Perhaps the manager (s) should have spent more time getting food out vs. standing front of the menu board trying to explain it all.  But then again he was too busy socializing with the hipster kids drinking water and overtaking the patio area to even notice the slow food times. 

My suggestion is the chicken sliders and call ahead at least an hour and get it to go.


Update.  I was contacted by the restaraunt and below is their response and my answer. 

Business Customer Service
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take this feedback very serious and we want to make this right. Can you please reply with your email and phone number? A member of our team will reach out to you for further assistance. -The Ribs & Burgers Team


Matt L: I am not looking for anything free or an apology.  Based on the mediocre quality of the food and the abysmal wait times (twice I have been and waited over 30 minutes) I am pretty sure I will not return.  Thanks for your concern though and hopefully this level of concern can be applied to the customer experience at the point of sale when it counts vs after the fact.  I hope you succeed and treat future customers better than I have been.  Good luck.

Food was good here. I had the lamb ribs and my husband had the beef rib. Very accommodating with no additional charge for changing the slaw Salad for the arugula. I would definitely come back for the food. However, when we got there the lone to order the food was long, the air condition I think was broken because it was so hot and they had fans blowing everywhere, and the food definitely took a long time to get to the table. I'm thinking I came at an "off" day where everything was probably going wrong for them. Definitely willing to give them another shot, and will change my review then.

I would eat here any day if the week!! This place is tucked away, hidden from anyone that wasn't told about it. So here I am telling you so you too can experience their delicious food and spread the word. 

My first time here I ordered their Greek salad and sweet potato tots. The salad was fresh and perfectly dressed with plenty of feta cheese and katamala olives...I'm grateful they didn't hold out on these because they're the best part of a Greek salad. The sweet potato tots are uh, uh, uh, good!!! They too were made fresh and served piping hot. I could snack of those bad boys all day! 

The second time I ate here I ordered the rib tipss off of the children's menu. These too were delicious. They were incredibly soft and slathered with tasty bbq sauce. My only gripe about them was there were small bones in almost each of them. For me it's only a slight inconvenience to maneuver around, but I could see a potential danger for children enjoying the dish. Parents you've been forewarned. This meal also came with perhaps the BEST french fries I've ever eaten. They were cooked perfectly, with a slightly crispy outside and soft center. These too were served fresh and hot with plenty of salt that kept me stuffing my face handful after handful.  

If you're in the mood for great, freshly prepared food in a laid back yet welcoming ambience then Ribs & Burgers is where you need to be!

We were so excited for Ribs and Burgers to come to Summerlin, however we were disappointed when we were finally able to try it. We went on 3/21 The only menu is inside, which if there is a line can make the entrance very stuffy. You order at the front counter from girls who don't seem to know what they are doing. The girl taking our order did not review our order, so I was a little worried it would be wrong. All drinks are bottled. No option of a glass of water, 3 of us chose no drink my son ordered a iced tea which was bottled and $3.50...You are given a numbered bucket with sauce, napkins and silverware after you order to take to your table, a little cheesy! I would rather have this at the table and just take a number. The food came to our table and was all correct. My son had the chicken breasts and fries, it was good. The burgers were also good. Not as well done as my husband had hoped but he should have asked, or for the price of the burgers they should ask! We also ordered wings, they were awful! The menu said crispy wings with BBQ or Spicy Buffalo, it was neither it was a very spicy chili sauce and soggy chicken wings. We did not end up eating them.  I would have much rather of had sit down service, no one checked on us to make sure everything was ok. It was 60 bucks for all 4, and we left thinking we would probably not go back.
Our groups number one pick of food. Always good combos great meat quality. Staff is friendly and always helpful. They serve alcohol. My favorite part of the restaurant is their hand washing sink.

Pretty yum! I felt like I was in the school cafeteria, ohh the memories... You order at the counter and your food will be brought to you when it's ready. Come to think, my school cafeteria did not have that type of service...
I went with the Aussie burger and fries and my honey had the burger and ribs combo. I felt like I was winning all around because he got the combo just so I can try the ribs, winning!!!!
The Aussie burber was pretty good. I love egg on my burgers, I do wish the egg was runny but that may be too sexy for a family establishment. The fries was delicious! I've recently that many places do not season their fries with salt which makes NO sense to me. Ribs and Burgers isn't one of those places. Great job on the fries. 
The burger and ribs combo comes with two sliders, half a rack of ribs and fries. The Mr got mixed his sliders, one chicken, one beef - he enjoyed both. The ribs were pretty yum! They ran out of beef ribs so he got baby back. They were tender and meaty, just how i like them ;)
I also had a boozy milkshake, I asked for it to be strong and THAT it was. They really hooked it up! I don't recall the name but it had pecans, bananas, Godiva, and icecream - so good!
The staff is super nice and willing to elaborate on the menu. I don't remember the name of the guy on the register but he was hella funny. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed by experience here and left with a stuffed belly. My guy ate ALL of his food, pretty rare.

We stumbled upon this place while checking out Downtown Summerlin. The menu has a nice variety of burger options. I didn't really check out the rib options since I was in the mood for a burger. I had sliders (one burger and one grilled chicken) with fries. The meats were great and each was paired with a unique sauce that went well with the meats. My husband had the lamb burger that he really enjoyed. Both of us noticed that the ingredients tasted fresh and higher quality.

If you're gonna have a "panera bread" concept restaurant you should either have fountain options for your guests or servers that can bring you more beverage refills. This place is going to struggle in the summer. Note that if you want another beverage, beer etc you have to get up and stand in line again.

Perfect- taller than a full bite- even smushed -perfect medium rare- hint of char - not burnt though- pickles were fresh- juices dripped out but didn't get on my hands- shoot even The napkins were quality-service was quick- $8 added a slice of American for $1- wait staff was smiling - place was clean- an staff was uber vigilant keeping it that way-
Just remembered -had some ribs the other day from R&B that were bomb-

I wanted to come here for lunch and finally tried it on a Sunday afternoon in Dec.  The place is nice and open with lots of tables and open kitchen. They have a great deal $10 burger, fries, soda combo.  The burger is seasoned well and tasty, the fries are crispy, and soda w/free refills.  The staff are nice and friendly.  I love their bbq sauce and thousand island dressing and dunk it on the fries which is the bomb.  First come in and welcome by cashier, order food, and sit anywhere.  Next time I would order their sweet potato tater tots and aussie burger w/fried egg.  I would definitely come back again.

Had dinner here mid-week with my fiancee who I would say has a palette for good meat.

Service was very friendly and quick given there were only a few patrons.

Fiancee ordered the Original Burger which was a good size and tasted delicious and fresh. Definitely enough food without a side of fries.

I had the Italian feather steak on a board with a side salad. I'm not a big steak person but when I have a craving I expect it to be filled with goodness.. and I'll have to say that Ribs and Burgers succeeded. The skirt steak wasn't tough, dry, or overcooked. It was probably one of the most tender and flavorful skirt steaks I've had.. and I feel like that's hard to do with that kind of cut. I dipped it a bit in their Pink Sauce which was delish. The salad was pretty good as well.

The atmosphere is great and the service seems genuine. Fiancee said he'd definitely come back again.. and he hasn't said that about too many places we have eaten at lately.

You know how you can just tell when a young person is full of promise? I am so impressed with this young man that works behind the checkout counter at this restaurant. His name is Spencer. I went to order a salad and a lamb patty, and before I could open my mouth he remembered everything about me and what I ordered (all the things I leave out of the salad, how I liked my lamb cooked, etc.) after only one time about six months ago. I watched him do this with so many customers in the line, and they were not all regulars. Many have only been there once like me. We were all amazed. And he manages to be witty and VERY smart and make interesting conversation without holding up the line. That is impressive! PS: The food is absolutely delicious and the service is great. Management needs to give this young man a raise! #spenseratribsandburgers #smartyoungpeople

I give this place a 3.5 - 4.  The atmosphere is cute, rustic, order at the counter and seat yourself.  We ordered the arugula salad (with bacon), and the rib and burger combo.  The salad was excellent and was plentiful (we shared it) the slider was mediocre, but the ribs were excellent!  We had the baby back and shared everything.  The service was wonderful!  They thoroughly explained the menu and jade helpful recommendations.  I would definitely come back when I am in a rib mood, not necessarily for the burger

This is my burger joint!!! Best burger i have ever tasted! Most places need to add toppings upon toppings in order to make they're buger taste good but they just hit the burger straight on and nailed it! Cool laid back atmosphere! To eat a burger anywhere else would be a crime . . .

Gave this place a second try after the first attempt was during a very busy evening and employees were just getting acclimated from the grand opening. Went last evening, it was once again in disarray. Employees did not know the menu, no one managing tables and the food was not correct. I tried to substitute fries for the sweet potato tator tots and was denied by the owner/manager. My wife tried to send back a chicken sandwich which had spicy chili topping added to her chicken sandwich. The waiter sat the sandwich on the counter for five minutes, then he brought it back and said we ordered that way. The chili was too spicy and turns out they charged us $1.50 extra for this option. Our friends ordered a plain chicken sandwich with no mayo. Guess what, it came with everything and extra mayo. She sent it back and they just scraped all the toppings in a bowl and gave her a fresh top bun. The toppings in the bowl still had mayo all over it. We couldn't get napkins, it's like they were for sale. My wife's and I bill came to $47.00 for two of us, which is too expensive for the wrong food and horrible customer service. We will not go back!

Best burgers and Ribs! Every time I come I'm not ever disappointed! The food is awesome. definitely a hidden gem. And if you love Lamb this IS the place to come to. YOU HAVE TO TRY THE LAMB RIBS!!!! They are Awesome!!!!!

Had the Beef Ribs and slider combo. Thought the sliders would be small, but are actually pretty filling and could have been my meal. Sliders alone were delicious, I added an egg on each one to make it even better. The beef ribs were also great. I gave four stars because I tried my wifes Wagyu burger, although it tasted good it was a bit overcooked. Asked for medium/well, but was well done. With that kind of quality beef, she should have ordered medium since it hardly has less  saturated fats to keep it moist. I would definitely go back for more.

I love their food! The ribs are sooooooo good. I had the pork and lamb rin combo. And their French fries are great! I like it here because it's just so nice sitting outside and enjoying my dinner. They are a little pricey but the food is still great!

Choose from salads, burgers and ribs with great portion sizes.  Order and sit with a cute teapot filled with napkins and utensils and it also serves as your table number.  The rack of ribs is huge and very reasonably priced for the portion.  I highly recommend the turkey burger with a fried egg, one of the best I've ever had.

The staff and management are involved and assure you fantastic customer service.

Ok, so we dropped in again before catching a flick.  Had the turkey burger again....always delightful, and this time had the Lamb Burger....Im sorry what, yes thats right Lamb Burger.  It was AMAZING. So much so that I just want to go back and have the Lamb Ribs.  Oh by the way, the service here is astounding.  I have since been back again with my family and the head Chef always makes a point to get out onto the restaurant floor, greet the family and make the kids laugh.  He alone encompasses what it means to provide great service in the restaurant industry.  This is by far our favorite burger joint, and we will go back again, and again, and again, and again, ok....enough

Worst service ever. The food was pretty good but it took 25 minutes to get our food. The manager was very rude. They didn't get our order right and we had to ask them to bring our fries. The manager didn't treat us with any respect when it was the restaurants fault for messing up the order. I said thank you when he brought the fries and the manager didn't say anything and just walked away. If the service and manager was better, I would of liked the restaurant better.

This is a counter service type restaurant. No reservations needed, tables are available on a first come basis. The decoration and atmosphere are pretty chill. 
The food was better than average, but not better than some of their major competitors like Bachi Burger. We ordered the lamb burger which had a good flavor. The meat was perfectly cooked, the arugula and feta cheese are very good complements. I would probably order this burger again. We also got the original which came with american cheese and bacon. I liked the fact that bacon was nice and crispy. Overall, this was a pretty average burger. The fries were nice and crispy and they were a good portion size for sharing. 
So if you are looking for a relaxed place to have good food, this is probably the place!

I understand there will be hiccups on the second day of opening, but this was ridiculous. I went with a friend and we ordered which was confusing because of the untrained cashier.  After I poured my water out of a sink, we received a bucket with a number on it and proceed to sit down. Some untrained (nice word) lady started to take my bucket thinking we were done; even though we are waiting for food. NOTE: this place was only 1/3 filled up with customers to almost dead during 1pm. After a period of time, I was handed my burger and fries as she first walked by my bucket because she could not read numbers. The burger was fair at best and the fries are nothing special. My friend, who had to ask the untrained lady, was still waiting on his burger as they forgot it and then it came out raw. Not impressed with this place. I will not go back. The female manager in civilian clothes needs to do her job and MANAGE!

I want to like Ribs & Burgers more, but I can't. With the word "burgers" in your name, one would expect a burger cooked correctly. I guess that's asking too much. I was torn between the Aussie and Wagyu, ultimately ordering the Wagyu burger. Burgers come cooked medium, so I went along with the recommendation. Unfortunately, mine came out well done. Such a waste of Wagyu beef. For a restaurant to be two levels off on the doneness scale is disappointing, especially considering I ordered at the recommended level.

The employees were friendly, but the speed of service was lacking. This restaurant doesn't know if it's fast food or sit down. I don't mind having no service after ordering at register, but you need to figure out your identity. If you have the soda fountain behind the counter and bring out drinks after seating as if it were a sit down restaurant, then you need to provide service and refills like a sit down restaurant. I finished my whole burger before ever getting a refill on my soda. By then it was too late.

On the bright side, the fries were tasty. They remind me of the fries I used to get at lunch in middle school. The sweet potato tots were delicious. You can't go wrong with sweet potato anything.

Horrible! Wait in line to order at the cashier on busy Friday night. The menu is right next to the cashier on a chalkboard so no time to figure out what you want. Once you order and pay you get a bucket of silverware (not enough for the four of us) with our number on it. There were no tables available after we paid so we stood there, and stood there. They just kept cranking out the people in line with no tables to be had as we all piled up with no where to stand. We finally saw our opportunity to bus our own table. Took forever for someone to figure out dirty dishes needed to be moved and still 4 glasses and the leftover tip stayed there for the duration of our visit. Waited 45 minutes for food which came delivered by the cook one plate at a time. Forgot fries, drinks, never got a receipt and to top it off the food was mediocre at best. Chopped salad was not chopped and had very little of anything in it, only good thing was tomatoes. Vegas pork ribs were tough, fatty, cold. Burgers were lukewarm and too rare. Never asked how we wanted them cooked. Watched people everywhere getting up to help themselves to ketchup, napkins, and whatever else they needed because what help there was were too busy trying to deliver food plates. They ran out of beef ribs and something else I heard them say while I was standing waiting for a table. A coke consisted of a 6 oz. coke bottle served without glass or ice. Water was a bottle - free. The host was pleasant and genuinely helpful but truly overwhelmed and even as things obviously fell apart his level of intensity never changed. It was almost as if he became numb at the extreme realization all was lost. Too bad.

Ribs & Burgers pleasantly surprised me with a lunch that far exceeded my expectations.  The restaurants in Downtown Summerlin are all just kind of...okay, so I wasn't expecting much from what I thought was just a generic BBQ joint.  Boy, was I wrong!  

I ordered the Lamb Burger, which had a nice tzatziki sauce and some feta.  The burger was cooked to a perfect medium rare (which I requested.  My boyfriend ordered the Wagyu burger (which I tried, of course) and it was excellent! He ordered medium rare and they erred on the side of rare - which is always the right choice with a good piece of meat.  

We also shared the Butchers salad, with easy dressing.  It was a pretty basic salad - nothing spectacular, but because the burgers were so good, I didn't need a stand-out salad.  

My only complaint is the bun.  For such great burgers, the buns were surprisingly awful.  They were too flaky and too big.  We saw someone else who had a different bun (maybe sesame seed)?  If you remember, ask for whatever alternate bun they have.  

I'll definitely be back to try those lamb ribs!

I need to come back to try their burgers and possibly other items, however, this review is based on their "Our Famous Fries" only.

I remembered their fries were really great from the YEE event, so when my friend wanted a snack (preferably fries), this was the first thing that popped into my mind.

You order at the counter and if you're dining in, you're given a numbered watering can with fry sauce, utensils, and napkins. Then, you choose a table in the dining room. There's also a sauce station where you can grab ketchup, mustard, etc.

The service and vibe of the place was wonky. There were only five other patrons at our arrival and it didn't feel welcoming. The person who took our order seemed to have difficulty and he was barely paying attention since a couple other employees were speaking to him at the same time. Although we only ordered fries, my friend had to repeat the order three times and she read it exactly as the menu listed it: Our Famous Fries. After our fries arrived, we requested a dish to put the fry sauce in and he was confused. Then, we saw him ask the kitchen staff and brought a large bowl to the table (the same one the fries arrived in). I'm not sure if that's typical, but it was an awkward situation for sauce and dipping fries. We were assisted by another person with fry delivery and water refills, and fortunately, he was very pleasant and helpful.

Anyway, the fries were even better than I remember. They have everything you want in a fry. Light, crispy exterior and tender interior. Very lovely. The fry sauce, although not as amazing as I recalled, was still a delicious companion. Those fries are enough to want to return again and again (and I will!).

I went here twice so far and Fries are super delicious, actually the best fries in LV I think, but burger is just ordinary taste sadly. Buns are normal levels and burger pate is just Nothing special taste. I like the shop's atmosphere and service is good also. So I hope they will reconsider of their burgers.
Ribs and Burgers has an awesome salmon burger.  I loved the Pyramid Apricot Ale as well.  Wait staff is friendly.  Carlos the GM is super personable.

Great service! We don't eat pork so we're always on the hunt for beef ribs. They're beef ribs are delicious! We've also tried their lamb and one of their burgers. My burger was a little burnt but I would probably try one of their other burgers. They also have the option to get it without buns. Their fries are also awesome.

Our go-to place for ribs!!

We had friends from out of town and decided to take them to Summerlin for ribs and burgers. My sister and I have tried this place before when they first opened and my husband has not been here. 

We ordered burgers, ribs and salmon. Everything was good and the ribs I ordered was very tender and falls off the bone. 

The place was a bit dirty. When I went to the restroom there was a plate of food on the floor. It took a while before someone came back to clean it up.

This was our first visit. The burgers were good and juicy, the fries hot and crisp! The service was awesome! Very attentive on refills and fast to bring  our food. All the workers were really nice! We will be back!

Overall, very good food but a few issues.  We had the baby back slab, which was great and huge.  1 slab will easily feed 2 people.  We also had the turkey burger and the lamb burger, both were juicy and excellent.  My most pressing issue is that the non-alcoholic beverages are all bottled, no fountain drinks or iced tea.  If you have beer taps, a soda machine is not out of line, or iced tea.  Also, 2 bottles of sauces were provided with the meal, one was your standard BBQ (not bad) and one was a sort of thousand island, I'm guessing.  Not sure what the point of the thousand island was.

Coming from Australia, I was expecting a little something from home. Disappointed for the price, I could have cooked and eaten the same burgers at home and fed 6 people, not 2. I can say I've been there. I'm giving 2 stars because the chips were good and they had fry sauce. Overpriced drinks too.

I enjoyed a really great lunch, from the food, choice of eating outdoors to the exceptional, prompt and courteous customer service.  
Front of the house manager Conrad was very knowledgeable with the menu and offered up some good choices. He was very patient, helpful and friendly. Adrian the cook went out of his way to make sure that my meal was delicious and enjoyable. Then to top it off, the manager Colin checked to make sure that everything was ok or if I needed anything.  All of them made me feel like I was the only customer at their restaurant.  They truly understand the meaning of excellent customer service!
Thank you to Colin, Conrad and Adrian at Ribs&Burgers for making my first trip to Downtown Summerlin a great one!!!

I really had high expectations for this place and I really hate to give low scores for businesses. I came here with a few buddies and my boyfriend to give it a try, and I am sad to say we were not extremely impressed. The people who work here are great except for 1 person. The guy that rang us up! No "have you been here before?" Or "I like this, try that..." nothing. He just gave an akward stare and had a personality of a wet mop! Other then that guy everyone else was super nice and energetic! 

As far as the food went the ribs were tender, but my boyfriend did not like the seasoning. Another thing he did not like was the way it was served. His FULL rack of ribs was served on a smaller board, making the ribs touch the table. Maybe think about a bigger cutting board for a FULL rack?? Although, these are clean tables its just akward when your bare food touches it. My other friend said it tasted like teriyaki chicken lol I had no idea what was on the sliders I had...there was no description and "Mr. Personality" didn't say anything. I am allergic to pickles and I find my worst enemy in my sliders...pickles. My friend who loves pickles didn't like the way they tasted. So it's safe to say we were all at a loss.
This is truly a "good ole reliable" burger place. Great food, excellent staff attitude, plenty of "fixins', sport TV from every angle. Outdoor dining in season. Works for me!

The steak was over cooked, asked for medium rare and it came out well done.  My waygu burger was asked to be made medium and it came out overcooked well done.

Good customer service but the food is lacking.  

I would not recommend, they have serious issues in the kitchen cooking the food, that's a core problem you can get around.

To all the people complaining about the service here:
QUIT YOUR WHINING!! This is not a full service restaurant!!
Now for my review:
The staff was very pleasant. The Wagyu beef burger (cooked medium) was fantastic! A little crispy on the outside and a little pink in the middle...perfect! We shared a salad that was good and the boozy birthday cake shake was awesome!! It's not a full service restaurant so you order at the counter and then someone brings you your food...(efficiently, in my opinion). I will definitely try the ribs next time!

Good ole' Christmas shopping. Me and my fiance got hungry and we decided to try this place after passing by it a couple times.

Looks nice and warm inside, I really liked how they decorated the place.  The service at the front was nice and friendly, gave us no trouble at all.  You either have an option of sitting down to eat after ordering or just taking it to-go.  We decided to sit down since we were tired of walking.

I'm a huge fan of ribs, but I decided to go different and get a lamb burger.  My fiance on the other hand got the ribs and burgers combo which comes with either french fries or salad (sneaky little b*stard knew I wanted ribs).  The combinations of my burger went really well together, I'm not a huge fan of sauce but I loved the Tzatziki sauce in it!  The meat was nice and juicy on mine.  For his plate, oh my goodness the ribs were just amazing!  I loved that they cook it fresh and there was a little char on it to give it a smokey taste.  And it wasn't dry!  Honestly I'd come here to eat ribs then Lucille's inside the Red Rock Casino.  The french fries were nice, golden, and not too crispy.  I didn't try his mini sliders but he said they were delicious.

For anyone looking for a great burgers and ribs place, this is it!  We're definitely coming back for sure.  Next time I'll get a plate of my own ribs and want to try their milkshakes!  =)

Forgot to mention that they have a sink to wash your hands in the middle of the seating area, very convenient!

I had high hopes for this restaurant, initial impressions were solid, very clean, trendy, nice decor. We ordered a slab of baby back ribs w/ fries, a bacon cheeseburger, and a steak salad. 
  Ribs - tender, and not bad. Definitely need to cover in the bbq sauce which is good.
  Burger - Very disappointed, wrong bun for this burger. Very dry and hard to eat. I was expecting a very tender, juicy flavorful burger ( since there is a HUGE display of meat grinders in the entrance). It should be said that the meat grinder display is why I ordered a burger. I was getting the steak sandwich before I noticed the grinders. Not the case, the meat was over worked and to compressed. I ordered med rare, what I got was med well. 
  Salad - It was a average salad with a average piece of over cooked steak.

  Burgers and Ribs... You hit 50% right, but you should be knocking the burgers out of the park! Grinding the meat daily, not over working and packing it. 

  Oh well, that is too bad!
Was waiting on a movie to start decided to grab a bite to eat here. Had the pocket burger the famous fries and a Diet Coke all for $10. Fast friendly service. Good food. I really like the fries!!

Waaaaaaaaaay over priced for this burnt burger...
Turkey burger was ok but my daughter burger was over chard not worth my money sorry 
No bueno

I love everything about this place. The food and the service deserve 5 stars!  My group came late night Sunday and we were about 20 of us. We were accommodated very well. The manager served us, made sure we don't run out of drinks and if we needed something. I forgot his name but he was superb! My ordered Aussie Burger-- WOW! The ribs and chicken wings were sooooo good!  I highly recommend this place.

The pocket burger lunch combo is a great deal! The burger was delicious and cooked perfectly! They have tons of choices and even vegetarian options! The customer service was above and beyond. We will be back!

Best cheese burger I've had in a long while= 5 stars! Reasonable prices, great location and casual atmosphere. I just can't give it 5 stars bc my ribs were burned to a crisp and very hard on my teeth to work the meat off. I will go back and give it another try especially bc the burger was so damn good.


Went in again and tried the beef ribs. Oh my gaaaaawd so damn good. And we've been back at least 3xs just for a bomb ass burger. It's now our go to place to take our out of town guests.

Having only ventured to this side of town once in a blue moon, we once again made the trek because our good friends wanted to try this place specifically. We arrive approximately 45 mins before 9pm (closing time) and place our orders. My husband and I order the rib and burger combo with baby back ribs and one chicken slider and one beef slider. Delish!! The beef slider was a perfect medium rare (something I only hoped for when I ordered rare), the sauce on the grilled chicken slider was very complimentary, and the ribs were perfectly charred on the outside and juicy on the inside. This place could use a couple more options for BBQ sauce given one of their two specialties is ribs, but very satisfying over all. The food was the reason for the 3 stars. The service was the reason for the lack of the other 2. When I got up shortly after ordering to ask for a couple lemons for our waters the cashier told us that she could not cut any more due to them closing soon and that I didn't want the ones they had because they were old. Huh? As I walked back to my table I was still mulling over this. Our food took about 30 minutes to come out. A little long, but no biggie it's ribs:) What really bothers me is when servers don't bother to refill drinks. Our whole table was drinking the same thing- water- and I wasn't until we were about to get up that anyone even came around to check on our drinks. Huh? I'm a very low maintenance person, but some things are basic. Other than those couple of things I have to say the food was admirable and the decor very interesting. I especially love the  sink in the middle of the restaurant. Maybe I'll give this place another try when they're not about to close:(
Absolutely loved this place! The food was amazing and the service was great refined casual atmosphere. Little pricier but worth every bite.

Interesting concept, design, and menu. Very good service and friendly staff. Now to the meat of it. We both ordered burgers. Buns very dry and too dense. Meat was old cow, too much yellow fat, or a dirty grill. Very funky and nearly inedible. Hope the ribs are very good or this will be the first food stop in downtown Summerlin to cycle through. Again, the service was excellent but food far short of professional.

Amazing experience! Sweet staff, excellent hands-on management, and DELICIOUS fresh food. It is so refreshing to be treated with respect at a restaurant in Las Vegas. I love this place and have already gone back multiple times since our first visit :)

Items Selected:
Lamb Slab with Chips
Pork Bullets with Chips and Slaw
Original Burger - Midwestern grain-fed beef, grilled, basted and served on a sesame bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, dill pickles and BBQ & pink sauces
Onion Strings
Kid Friendly Maple Bacon Doughnut - Vanilla Ice Cream, doughnut, bacon, maple syrup  
Kid Friendly Pecan Banana Split - Vanilla Ice Cream, Godiva caramel, banana, pecans  
Kid Friendly Birthday Cake - Vanilla Ice Cream, milk, sprinkles
