Invited in by Public Relations while the Australian Team was still in town working on issues related to food, service, and design it was just prior to 5:00pm that a friend and I approached Downtown Summerlin's Ribs & Burgers, and with a line of perhaps twenty snaking out the front door our first impression was one echoed by several previous visitors - pure chaos, several potential patrons taking a pass while we actively had to seek out our liaison, a three person process that took us through two persons who seemingly had no clue what was going on.

Described (more than once) as a quick casual concept, the focus on quality food without the 'fine dining' feel, Ribs & Burgers acts as if their setup is something unfamiliar despite locations such as MTO Café offering the exact same thing, but by shortening the distance from entrance to counter while servers still in-training struggle with a rather limited menu the result is one with peculiar delays and prolonged lingering - the diner eventually receiving a numbered bucket and left to find themselves a seat while food is prepared.

Spending most of the early visit speaking to Mona, a pleasant brand spokeswoman clearly excited by the prospect of brining the high quality concept to US Shores, it was perhaps a ten minute wait between ordering and receiving our food and having heard so much about the braising process, special sauce, and sourcing of meat and produce it was with high expectations that first bites of 'pork bullets' were enjoyed - each bite not exactly 'falling off the bone' tender, but decidedly well prepared with nuances of sweetness rounded out by several sorts of spice.

Having received no water on order, and only two napkins for a meal that was obviously quite likely to be messy, it was on request that the first was delivered while the second never appeared and allowing for the fact that our order continued to arrive as readied from the kitchen with only one mistaken item appearing unannounced it was onward to the burger, 'chips', and onion straws that our dining commenced, the fries completely forgettable and really no better than those from the Golden Arches while the piled-high burger and crispy onions were indeed quite good, the former featuring a great grind beneath a good sear while the latter were surprisingly dainty and entirely greaseless with plenty of natural flavor to be found.

Moving onward to the most intriguing item, the novelty of lamb ribs not lost on someone who loves lamb and finds it far underrepresented on menus here in the States, suffice it to say that the meat's natural flavor was not overwhelmed in the least by the braise or the baste and although the provided knife was barely capable of sawing through connective tissue adjoining the rack a little elbow grease proved well worth the effort, each saporous bite offering a reason to return even when taking into account the somewhat sizable tab for something served in a 'quick, casual' space.

Rounding out the evening with a trio of shakes, at this point a 'must' for any place serving burgers in the 702, we were told by the man up front that the team had recently stopped using gelato from Messina as they wanted something more 'thick and rich,' but whether an effect of temperature, prep time, or our decision to eschew alcohol only the Pecan Banana Split proved truly memorable in texture or taste - the birthday cake thin and milky with sprinkles clogging the straw while the Maple Bacon Donut tasted mostly like creamy Log Cabin syrup without a bit of pork or smoke to be found.

Still finding their footing in terms of service and structure while already serving up some rather excellent 'American Classics,' no matter where the concept hails from, it will be interesting to see how Ribs & Burgers does as other similar speed locations with more local recognition open nearby at a lower price point.  Certainly offering something a little different, with high quality ingredients readily apparent, it will require a few tweaks to make Ribs & Burgers really 'work,' but if these things can get dialed in I've no doubt the concept could succeed in several large markets nationwide.

Stopped in with my family including a picky two year old last weekend and had a great experience. Everything we ordered was good (two burgers, pork ribs, kids cheeseburger), and everything came out within 10 minutes. The fries were basic and incredibly good. Servers brought water to our table on request. We loved the sink in the restaurant, perfect for those with small children. The price was what I would expect for all that we ordered. Overall I would totally recommend, great place to stop after shopping.

Ribs & Burgers, do you pay attention to yelp?

The first time we came here, a couple interrupted us at the register to say they had been waiting forty minutes for their food. The woman actually encouraged us to leave. So we did.

It was one of those moments where curiosity gets the best of you, so we went back the next day. I guess we waited 15-20 minutes, which is fine. I was afraid my vegetarian burger would be bland, so I ordered jalapeños. This was not the case! The portobello was packed with flavor. Super delicious. It was also so big that I didn't need to order the sweet potato tots. My only compliant is that the mushroom is so juicy that it made the bottom bun soggy (yuck), but maybe that's just #portobelloproblems.

The lamb rack was served over fries, and whatever issues he had with it seemed to be inherently lamb related (tougher type of meat, etc). 

Some issues need to be remedied: house water, or a quicker way to order a second drink (perhaps asking a passing server), and bigger plates. Serving meals on a cutting board is cute, but doesn't leave enough room to effectively cut your rack of ribs. Some proper hot sauce would be nice too.

With all the good places to get good burgers and ribs in Vegas, this place needs to try a bit harder when it comes to service and food. Sorry, AUS!

Italian-Style Feather Steak and Chips:
Grain-fed tenderloin with herbs, lemon and olive oil. It's simple and nothing special. 3/5

Chicken Breast and Salad:
Two succulent breasts. Yup! The breasts were not dry and were quite tasty with the lemon and herbs. 3.5/5

$17-20 for an entree that's marginal isn't justifiable.

Came here for lunch on a Sunday. Wasn't crowded. I had the slider duo 1 chicken and 1 beef. Both tasty. I did like the beef more then the chicken.The fries I loved . Simple place , good for lunch. Friendly service relaxing vibe! Came here again for lunch. Burger was super tasty. My parents came here for dinner they were very pleased. They had the ribs and Salmon which I'm now looking forward to trying . Parents are picky eaters so when they like something that must mean it was really good :))) 5 stars is well deserved for the yummy food!

My wife and I brought our visiting brother-in-law from Hawaii here because he wanted to "try something different". They didn't disappoint. My wife had a really tasty Salmon Burger, I had a delicious Ribs & Burger combo and went with the Lamb for ribs. If you've never had Lamb as a rack of ribs, I highly recommend it! Very juicy, fatty, and seasoned very very well. My bro-in-law opted for the Lamb Burger which he loved and said it was very tasty. The beer selection is interesting as far as selections available and they had some that I have never heard of. The guy behind the counter was extremely informative and even let us sample a few of them before we made our decision! Great food, good customer service, and tasty beverages!

First time eating here.

Love this restaurant.  The food is delicious. Cooked when you order. All tastes so fresh. The ribs fall right off the bone. Our group had 12 very hungry people and we didn't have to wait long for our food. The staff was so friendly, professional, and attentive. They even went the extra mile and made the four children in our group mini milkshakes. 

Will definitely return.

Great place for Baby Back Ribs in Vegas!
Downtown  Summerlin 
Great sink in middle of place to wash your hands!
All the burgers were cooked to perfection!!
Would recommend to anyone
It was average at best, I  had the lamb ribs and they were really tough, they had good flavor, just tough......  Most likely will not go back, just way too many better places to eat....

This place has great decor and good burgers. Had the sliders and my boyfriend had the special Aussie. He loved his but I think it was ok, not amazing. I would definitely go back and try the ribs! 
The sliders was a good portion, comes with fries and cold slaw. I had chicken and beef.

Using other Yelpers as my scouting reports, it seemed like this place was getting beat like a Taiko drum during its initial stages, including at a YEE. More recently, it seemed like ratings were on the upswing and since my family will easily come to consensus agreement on burgers for a meal, we stopped in on a Saturday afternoon.

Without any line, we ordered five sandwiches and I was pleased that the young man at the counter reviewed the entire order before he entered it. I ordered the Wagyu burger with a Brooklyn Brown Ale. Also ordered were the Pocket, the Old School Cheese, the Chili Chicken, the Turkey, and sides of fries and sweet potato tots to share.

My burger was cooked as I ordered with the beef being juicy and flavorful. Sauces are something I don't prefer on my burgers, but the BBQ and pink sauces paired well with my sandwich. The sweet potato tots had a crispy outside with steaming hot shredded sweet potato on the inside. They didn't last too long on the table. Other than my wife's burger being under-cooked to her liking but still edible, everyone else polished off their sandwiches completely.

We had no issues with service, which included about a short ten minute wait for food and a visit by a manager at our patio table to check on us. $75 might be a little steep for a party of five but a price I'm not up in arms about. We'll definitely be back to try the ribs. If the ribs are worthwhile, and if they can maintain satisfactory service, Ribs & Burgers shouldn't have any trouble succeeding.
We both had burgers! Mine had egg, avocado, lettuce, & onion. It was cooked perfect! I would definitely come back!
They have like 6 people working and no cashier to take our order. What kind of place is this?They just looks at us and continue doing whatever they were doing. It's not like the place was so so busy.
Finally a burger joint that knows how to make a burger!!! Food was awesome and service was great. Spencer is at the front taking orders and is awesome!

There is a tv.  The person who takes orders needs training....ribs were superb, burger was great as well.  Slaw dressing wasnt too good.  Great atmosphere.   Manager and chefs were helpful and friendly.   I will be back.

I have been to this sit down half dine in half self service restaurant two times and have enjoyed myself! 

My order both times was the combo which consisted of a half rack of pork ribs, two sliders, one chicken and one beef with a chocolate milkshake as my side. The food was a little different the second time around but still delicious. I enjoyed there crispy fries more than the somewhat soggy sweet potato tots but my family had a different opinion!

Snappy, slow and dirty. That's just to order!
Not enough fries, napkins or even straws. Table was very dirty even though there wasn't that many people there. 
Burger was ok, meat was good bun was too thick and hard. I am happy we ordered the combo special $10. Will not be back.
Too expensive for a burger joint, I paid $100 with tip for 4 adults and 1 toddler. The service was bad. Our order was wrong twice, and I had to leave my table twice to correct it.

Skip!

With all the food competition in downtown summerlin I would expect this place is not long for this world. But some of you seem to like it and while that confirms my pessimistic views of humanity, I will try to set the record straight.

The place looks pretty nice. It's casual and probably a fun place to hang out and the presentation of the food is enjoyable. The let's put our food on a slab of wood style can be found here.  But past the appearance lies food that should leave you wondering who exactly did they hire to run this kitchen.

-Beef Ribs. Tough chewy and borderline edible. BBQ sauce certainly not A+ so nothing to offer here.

-Burgers. As a category these are probably slightly below average. I've had a few different ones and they are both indistinguishable from each other but pretty much just sloppy messes. No add ons will fix that the buns don't appear to be made in house, nor is the meat seasoned all that well. They just slap on thousand island and hope for the best.

-Fries. I don't even understand what they do to these. They feel like cardboard, certainly not crispy. Close to flavorless.

-Sweet Potato Tots. Soggy and not seasoned. Bleh.

-Orange Creamsicle Shake. Okay this was actually good but Im just gonna go to Jamba if I want an orange creamsicle drink. Maybe the drink gave this place it's extra star. Maybe.

If you're high maybe you'd like this place. Otherwise just pick any of the other 50 fast service restaurants in the shopping mall.

I was really disappointed. A lot of my complaints are things that can be modified to make the experience better but due to the number of little things, it seems like a bad execution of a mediocre concept.

FOOD: OK
I got a burger with mushroom(s) and cheese. THe meat was cooked really well. Many of my complaints about medium rare in vegas are that most places think that rare  is medium rare. And its not. They had their meat temp spot on. The presentation was definitely arty/rustic, but completely pointless. My burger was over 9 inches high and I had to disassemble it to even start to eat it. The mushroom was a solid portobello cap that was grilled. Tasted good, but non functional because the minute you bit into a whole cap that's been grilled, all the juices come out at once. Makes for a messy addon with a burger when some assembly is already required. 

With so much work required to deal with the food, i'm not sure why they put a piece of paper under your burger and then serve your burger with a fork and knife. "Here, you're totally going to need to use these and we're going to make you work for it." 

There were a lot of fries. They didn't say that when i ordered and they needed too. One for me and one for my two year old. Extreme overkill. I mean heart attack overkill.

My son tried the chicken burger, First, its not a burger, its a chicken breast slider. Second, massively over marinated meats aren't a good idea for children menu items. In fact, I won't ever go back with my kid because there's nothing for him there.

SERVICE: Good - we were in early so i'm not sure what the rush hour service is like. 

AMBIANCE - good/confused - i tend to wonder why so much is spent on dust collecting decor - having a hundred meat grinders sitting in steel shelves just seems not too efficient. But it didn't impact the taste so...
Great burgers. Their classic steak sandwich is incredible. They have great customer service. They came by often to ask if everything was ok. I definitely would recommend this place.

Husband and I were disappointed. For the high prices, the lamb & pork ribs were chewy, greasy and charred on ends. We didn't like the taste. The salmon was good. It came with a side of potato tots which were also good. Our friend didn't like the burger. I didn't like that we had to carry our own drinks and sauce bucket to the table. When we paid up front for the food, I left a tip then carried my own items to the table. This is confusing. It seemed like a walk up & order, high priced, bus your own table type of joint.

This place does not even deserve to be in business.  Their employee Dillon kicked out a family because their little girl, who has autism was standing on the booth in her socks singing.   Extremely rude and discriminatory......skip it and go somewhere that does not discriminate.  If I could give LESS than 1 star I would.

I stopped in the other day on a whim. I had a pleasant experience. I originally ordered a burger but at the suggestion of the staff I changed to a 1/2 rack of Baby Back ribs. They were delicious. IMHO ribs should just fall off the rib when you pick it up. You should still have to eat it....and eat it I did. There wasn't too much sauce on the ribs, I think just the right amount. I will be going back to try other things. I suggest you give them a try.

Outstanding baby back ribs cooked to perfection. Gr8 burgers and sliders.  Veggie burger rocks.  Fries and cabbage salad are tasty.  Service is fine.  Nice ambiance and spacious w/people-watching patio.

I like the atmosphere. Problem one: the menu is behind you when you're in line and at the register.  I ordered the wagyu burger medium rare.  It came out well done.  I ate it because we were trying to make a movie. The flavor was really good, just way over cooked. The GM offered to buy my next burger. Also really choppy service. Everything we ordered came out one thing at a time. Still working out the kinks at this new location.

Stumbled upon this little eat in or out restaurant in Town Center by the theatre.  Wow!  I seriously have never had such tasty perfectly cooked baby back ribs.  We have been there 3 times in two weeks.  The atmosphere is great, the servers are beyond accommodating and nice.  They have a condiment station in the middle of the restaurant so you don't have to wait while your food gets cold.  The french fries are to die for.  No grease and each one is crunchy.  My favorite is the rib and burger platter which is 1/2 slab ribs, 2 sliders, and a salad or fries.  Try it you'll love it!

First off, walking into the restaurant is uncomfortable because there is a cluster of people reading the menu board right in front of the cashier. 

We were pretty optimistic being all we ordered was hamburgers and French fries... And I guess that is all we should have expected.

After ordering the food we waited probably 25 minutes before we even saw a waiter... And when they finally brought us our lunch only half of it was there. When the final burger made its grand appearance my other half cut into it and it was completely raw in the center. Not medium as they said it would be, but the meat itself was cold and squishy to the touch as if it had never seen any heat. 
We immediately flagged down a waiter and expressed our discontent and they swept it off and promised another... Being that it is a new restaurant we forgave the mistake easily. BUT when we got the replacement burger another ten minutes later it arrived exactly the same. Raw in the center. We typically give every new restaurant a second chance, but that won't be happening.... I can tell you one thing, going their simply made me long for the amazing food across the way at Grape Street.

Friendly service. The prices are a little steep for what you get. I ordered the combo which was 10 dollars and a beer and the price was $18.92! Otherwise everything is a la carte so I'm sure it can get pricier. This is why the 3 stars. Otherwise, burger was fine but for the price, I was expecting hand-cut fries. Not store bought. For a hipster burger place , this is a little detail that shouldn't be overlooked. Plus they weren't salted!

I was really looking forward to this restaurant when I found out it was an Australian restraint that served lamb. Unfortunately it just seemed to fall short. I ordered the lamb ribs and a naked lamb burger because I LOVE lamb. The ribs came out first and they lacked any discernible flavor. It was under seasoned and swam in oil. The burger came out and I had to send it back. The lettuce was brown and wilted. When the burger came back I had a few bites and I was really disappointed. The burger was under seasoned too. The burger was supposed to be a Mediterranean lamb burger but there wasn't even a hint of the Mediterranean. I was devastated. Under seasoned, over cooked, and underwhelming.

I love Ribs. I love Burgers. I love BBQ. So this place had peaked my interest since I saw a Yelp event scheduled for here. But my friend beat Yelp to it by suggesting it one Saturday afternoon so off we went around 4pm.

It's a nicely decorated, modern looking place. Lots of meat grinders filling the shelves. Not just a couple, but maybe 80 of them. Don't ask me why I found this fascinating. I just did. I also found fascinating the fact that there is a sink located right in the middle of the restaurant. 

My friend and I decided to go for ribs, so we ordered the Vegas Rib plate for $18. Comes with two meaty portions of baby back ribs, and 3 Short Ribs. 

Baby Back Ribs were very good, firm yet tender the way ribs are supposed to be. If you think great ribs fall off the bone, then you don't know good ribs. They come seasoned with a sauce, which was mild with a hint of pepper. Very tasty and I enjoyed them 4.5/5

Short Ribs were also cooked to perfection with a sweet sauce that wasn't korean kalbi sauce and wasn't teriyaki, but a new sauce for my palate. I loved them! 5/5

Negatives..... Cole Slaw....served in a thimble sized dish, this wasn't creamy or vinegary or anything. Lacked any imagination. We both thought it wasn't good.

Table BBQ sauce.....I poured some out and my friend asked what it was. I took a taste, and didn't know. I took another taste....still didn't know. He took a taste, and said it was ketchup. I disagreed because there was a hint of some kind of extra flavor. Our waitress said it was BBQ sauce. I'd pass on this.

Overall, this is pretty decent BBQ, way better than Rollin Smoke. Those guys should visit these guys and learn to cook ribs. Portions were great for $18. Next time I will try a burger as they looked pretty big and delicious coming out to the other patrons.

1st time trying this place. Long story short, the service and the food was great! When my friend saw it was rated 3 1/2 stars she was kind of iffy on going. I told her  we gotta be the judge for ourselves. So I convinced her to go anyway. From the moment we walked in we were greeted very nicely. We both got the Original burger with American cheese. I added bacon. And shared an order of sweet potato tots. All the food was fresh. The burgers tasted like they were home made right off of a good quality family BBQ. Throughout our meal, different people kept checking up on us making sure everything was ok and asking if we needed refills. Overall, it was a great experience!

I love lamb more than any other kind of meat. I can't believe I've never seen nor had grilled lamb ribs until tonight. They were so delicious that I can't praise them enough. They were so tender, juicy and so flavorful - and cooked medium exactly as I ordered. They tasted like they had been marinating for days in a lemon herb sauce. When they were served they had this incredible caramelized glaze on them. The severing size was very generous too. I hear this is an Aussie concept, and they sure know their lamb.  The french fries are a real treat too - crispy but not crunchy, with just the right amount of salt. Fortunately, or unfortunately, you just can't stop eating them. 

The decor is kind of modern but comfortable - not cool, hard as bricks little chairs, but lots of comfy banquettes. I'm the kind who hates having sticky hands after I eat ribs, but I hate those smelly wet naps even more. This restaurant has a sink right in the middle of it to wash your hands before and after eating - what a pleasure. The staff was friendly, and I loved the open kitchen concept. The aromas of the grilled meats waft throughout the restaurant. The music is not too loud either, as in many restaurants these days. You don't have to shout and lean across the table to be heard.

I can't wait for my family to come to town so that I can take them to have these ribs - they all love lamb as much as I do. I'll definitely return to this restaurant frequently to have more of those ribs. It seemed like a great, casual place to go for lunch or dinner, and particularly before going to the movies a 1/2 block away.

I gave a low rating and they msg me asking me for my info to discuss the nasty things I observed. No one contacted me until many days after. Why would you ask a customer for their contact info and not contact them immediately? It shows how much they value their business and customers. This place should just close down.

The food came out cold. Nothing about the food was special or even good. Overpriced for terrible quality. Friendly staff, that's about all I can say. I will not be returning or recommending this place.

Service and food were exceptional! Place is a order and then sit down restaurant. Takes some getting use to cause at first glance the place is nicely decorated you would assume they take your order table side. But it works and we enjoy coming here to eat. The staff is always friendly and constantly check in with you to make sure everything is ok! This must stem from the Manager Brandon, you won't miss him he's as friendly as friendly come. Always makes sure your service is met with a smile and constantly checking on his staff to make sure everyone is taken care of. If you want great service and food, look no further. 

Recommendations.. Smother your burger with the Pink sauce and order the onion strings, they're to die for!

$50 for 2 people....

Mediocre food and the price doesn't fit what you get (yeah that rhymes). If I have to pay that much I would want someone to come to the table and take my order. I should not have to wait in line to order food and pay more than it will cost me if I went to a full service restaurant. 

Order - Ribs, Burger, and Creamsicle shake. 

Pros - The location is great. Outside seating is nice. Good service. The burger was good

Cons - Price, ribs were just ok at best. creamsicle shake was $10 and was nasty.

October 7 is a special anniversary for Ribs and Burgers. I wasn't sure if it was the birthday of this particular location or that of their original restaurant. Whatever the case may be, the tall and very pleasant-looking lady who took my order, excitedly told me that I would received $5 off my order of their Original Burger. Sounds good to me!!!

I also added a side of bacon to that order. Probably the best thing you can do to their burgers. If you are not opposed to having bacon in your diet, then forking over another $1.40 for their bomb bacon is a must!  It is smoky, crispy and good that must be why it is the number one banned substance by some major world religion.  Based on just having their bacon, I think their ribs is likely to be above average too. 

So before I get ahead of my self this is what I ordered on my inaugural visit to Ribs and Burgers.

Original Burger - Grain-feed Beef Patty, Grilled, Basted, and served on Sesame Seeded Bun with Iceberg Lettuce, Tomato, Spanish Onion*, Dill Pickles, and their Pink & BBQ Sauce.  Added the Bacon.  I added the BACON!

Aussie Burger - Grain-feed Beef Patty, Beetroot, Pineapple, Swiss Cheese, Bacon, Fried Egg, Iceburg Lettuce, Tomato, Spanish Onion*, Dill Pickles, and their Pink & BBQ Sauce.

Non-alcoholic version of the S'Mores Me Up Milkshake (Ice Cream, Marshmallow and Hersay's Chocolate).

Ordering process was friendly and smooth.  There was a small crowd ahead of me, so the modest wait time was completely acceptable. But that area is not large, so line will easily go out the door if there is more than about 10 people placing their order or waiting to do so.

There is a huge menu for you to inspect just inside the door, which is pretty straight forward.

About the food. My S'Mores Me Up Shake took a few minutes to be served. But it looks and tasted just like a plain chocolate milk shake. No marshmallow or pieces of real Hersey's Milk Chocolate pieces to garnish came with the order. I am assuming that their recipe has changed since they opened, because Yelp photos of the same drink looks different than mine. Maybe the non-alcoholic version does not get the same finishing touches as the age-restricted version.  Subtle age discrimination at work here. Junior Civil Rights Groups, Teen Titans, and Young Justice League would all be outrage at the fact that minors and those that opted to not booze it up are not receiving equal treatment under FDA restaurant labeling requirements.  All this potential legal drama over an innocent milkshake!!!

Aussie Burger - Very substantial burger!  Most people can't even open their mouth wide enough to fit this burger. I suspect that magical Slytherin or muggles with the ability to unhinged their jaw or expert practitioners of foot in mouth talent (e.g., Donald Trump?) would be capable of accomplishing this feat. 

Totally got sidetracked. So... Best part about this burger is that it comes with BACON. Plain old raw Red Onion served in all burgers instead of the sweet Spanish Onions (* Spanish Onions have lower sulfur content, naturally sweeter but with shorter shelf life) in the description.  The Fried Egg would be better if is closer to the "over easy", so the runny  yolk can add that extra richness to the burger experience. The pineapple and beetroot can both be eliminated, it didn't add anything except bulk and carbs.  Overall just an average premium burger.

The Original Burger is decent, closer to the ideal for purist, I personally think that it is better than the Aussie once the BACON is added.

Medium was requested for doneness, but both burgers served closer to well done (just a tiny bit of red left on a canvas of brown. Still juicy, but that is probably because they baste it during the grilling process.

A nice amenity provided by the restauranteur is a hand sink in the middle of the dining area. No need to find a restroom or organize all your girlfriends for an expedition, just to not have sticky hands on the drive to the next destination.

Summary: Outdoor seating area is nice when the temperature is not excessively hot or cold. Burgers are just alright. I really wish it was better given the effort to develop their signature burgers. I overpaid for chocolate shake which I can get cheaper and better at Burger King (BK Vanilla Milkshake tops my list for fast food milkshakes).  Their $10 lunch combo is a good value if you are already at Downtown Summerlin.

3 stars (rounding up).
Good fresh burgers & a nice staff! I think the head chef said his name was Michael...he was such a nice guy! He came out and checked on us a couple times. We'll be back to eat here again!

I would give this place more stars but, the service was so-so and lagging. I do love the salmon burger and their onion strings. But, if it's your first time here go with the original the ribs and burger combo it's a must!

So I was contacted by the shop, asked for my phone number to discuss further. Nobody - to this day - contacted me. 
Feedback must not be that important.

Ordered the classic cheeseburger, sweet tator tots and the chopped salad. It was all good. Didn't wow us. Didn't say can't wait to come back.  A bit pricy. Cashiers could have been a bit more friendly. Glad to see they are now offering water to customers.  I think for the price and no table service, there are too many other restaurants I would go to first for a burger and salad.

This was our first visit.  Service was fast. We ordered a half rack of baby back with the cabbage slaw.  The 1/2 rack was the smallest we'd ever seen (approximately 6 inches long). Flavor of sauce was good but the ribs were burnt on the underside.  Cabbage slaw was tasty and a generous amount.  I had to ask for black pepper as no condiments on the table.  We may return to try the burgers but definitely not the ribs. Fool me once, etc.
